Comfortable, modern, lively and light: this is how this hostel -newly renovated in 2007- defines itself. It is located very close Gran Vía and Malasaña district and its great nightlife offer. All the rooms (single, double standard, double superior and double with jacuzzi) are provided with bathroom, TV, heating, air conditioning, and WiFi.

Rooms are decorated with matching colours –red, yellow, purple, blue, white…- in order to create a pleasant atmosphere. They offer services like laundry, safe deposit-box, luggage room, fax and Internet. Always trying to offer the best to their customers, they also have a car rental service, they provide information about interesting trips, and they advise you about the best tourist options and tour operators in Spain.

basicData.name: Hostal Cervantes
basicData.title: Hostal Cervantes
basicData.body: The Hostal Cervantes is a peaceful welcoming establishment, located in the heart of the Barrio de las Letras. It offers 20 comfortable cosy rooms, all with private bathroom, television, Wi-Fi, hair dryer, heating, and safe. Thanks to its central location, the Cervantes is just a five-minute walk from an array of bars and restaurants.

basicData.name: Buenos Aires
basicData.title: Buenos Aires
basicData.body:
Buenos Aires is a modern and comfortable hostel belonging to NH Group hotels chain. It is located on the main commercial artery of the city, Gran Vía, well connected –both walking and by public transport- to the most important tourist and leisure attractions.

Their rooms (single, double, twin and triple) include bathroom, telephone with direct external line, desk, Climalit double glazing and free WiFi service, among other services. In addition, they offer fax service, copying service, 24-hour locker for customers and laundry.

basicData.name: Centro Sol
basicData.title: Centro Sol
basicData.body: With a familiar atmosphere and classic style, this hostel occupies two floors of a newly renovated building, a few minutes from Puerta del Sol. The services offered to customers are luggage storage, heating, air conditioning, free Internet, lift, satellite TV and disabled access among others. It includes a close-circuit TV camera external surveillance system installed in the main door and in each of the two floors. Rooms have electronic card access. Familiar ambience. Classic style.

basicData.name: Hostal Ballesta
basicData.title: Hostal Ballesta
basicData.body: Just a stone's throw from Gran Vía, this recently renovated hostel is modern and welcoming. It offers large and comfortable rooms - singles, doubles, and triples - with private bathroom, flat screen TV, telephone, heating, air conditioning, and Wi-Fi.

basicData.name: Bruña
basicData.title: Bruña
basicData.body:
This is a hostel for those who want to be surrounded by art even when they sleep. It is superbly located facing the Prado museum, and two minutes from Thyssen and Reina Sofía museums. Bruña offers comfortable, big and renovated single and double rooms. They store your luggage for no extra charge and have free WiFi access at the reception hall at your disposal.

They want to offer a cheaper alternative for visitors who don’t need all the services offered in a hotel, yet they give a huge importance to a good customer service. This is their main highlight: an attentive and helpful service. They also have apartments with kitchen for those who want to stay for more than seven days.

basicData.name: Tijcal II
basicData.title: Tijcal II
basicData.body: This hostel is located right in the centre of the old part of the city, just a few metres away from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The staff offers personalized attention and speaks several languages fluently, making it the perfect place to go for international tourists. Besides, they offer other optional services like breakfast in bed, laundry or wake-up service. When they arrive, customers are given a map of the city and they are informed about different activities such as flamenco shows and musicals, car rental, room service (pizzas), etc.

basicData.name: Barrera
basicData.title: Barrera
basicData.body:
This hostel is superbly located to get to know the city and visit any cultural, tourist or leisure attraction without taking public transports: theatres, concerts, flamenco shows, museums (Prado, Reina Sofía and Thyssen) and other tourist attractions like Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, or Gran Vía.

Another advantage is that it is only five minutes from Atocha station, a good reason to arrange trips to surrounding areas. It offers big, comfortable, clean and newly renovated rooms. Service is attentive and friendly. Besides, they speak English, which makes it a good option for foreign visitors. Good value for money.

basicData.name: La Selecta
basicData.title: La Selecta
basicData.body: Right on Madrid’s Gran Vía we find this small two-star hostel, very close to the city’s tourist spots: Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Puerta de Alcalá and major museums such as the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofía, an ideal place to enjoy the leisure, culture, and shopping on offer in Madrid. All the rooms have their own private bathroom, TV, air conditioning, heating, and free Wi-Fi connection.

basicData.name: El Tera
basicData.title: El Tera
basicData.body: This hostel is located in the central district of Las Letras, ideal for those looking to enjoy Madrid’s major museums, gastronomy, and the nightlife of one of the city’s liveliest areas. The rooms come with heating, private balcony, and free Wi-Fi connection.

basicData.name: Avenida
basicData.title: Avenida
basicData.body: Avenida hostel is located on the fourth floor of a historic stately building. Newly renovated in 2007, this hostel offers comfortable single and double rooms. Some of the windows don’t overlook the street, yet others face onto the important street of Gran Vía and have a small balcony. A recommended place to go with friends. It is superbly located, next to the main interesting tourist and leisure places in the city.

basicData.name: La Unión
basicData.title: La Unión
basicData.body: This two-star hostel is located in the heart of Chueca, just a few metres from Gran Vía, one of the city’s liveliest districts. It is a cosy, peaceful, friendly place, with views over the popular Plaza de Vázquez de Mella and surrounded by theatres, cinemas, restaurants, and nightspots. It has 16 rooms, all with their own private bathroom, heating, air conditioning, telephone, television, and Wi-Fi.

basicData.name: América
basicData.title: América
basicData.body: This central hostel in calle Hortaleza offers 20 rooms (single, double, triple and quad) with private bathroom and TV. The hostel is on a fifth floor and customers can enjoy a 60 square meters balcony in the reception hall, a pleasant terrace in the city centre. Nice and attentive service. English spoken, an extra advantage for international tourists.

basicData.name: Los Alpes
basicData.title: Los Alpes
basicData.body: This is a welcoming hostel at affordable prices. It is situated in a building from the early 19th century, newly renovated, right in the centre of Madrid: in calle Fuencarral, a street where you will find the most fashionable shops with the latest design tendencies in fashion. It is just 20 meters away from Gran Vía and a short distance from Puerta del sol. Youthful and lively ambience.

basicData.name: Almanzor
basicData.title: Almanzor
basicData.body: Hostel located right in the centre of Madrid, close to the Puerta del Sol, an unbeatable location to visit the city’s major attractions such as museums, shops, and restaurants. Its rooms are spacious, comfortable and well equipped, each with its own private bathroom.

basicData.name: Aliste
basicData.title: Aliste
basicData.body: Hostel located in the most central area of Madrid, very close to its major museums, Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofía, and other tourist attractions such as the Plaza Mayor, the Puerta del Sol and the shopping area around Calle Preciados. Its rooms come with all mod cons: television, fridge, hair dryer, free Wi-Fi, safety deposit box, etc.

basicData.name: Alhambra Suites
basicData.title: Alhambra Suites
basicData.body: The Alhambra is a hostel located right in the centre of Madrid, a stone’s throw from the Puerta del Sol and the Plaza Mayor. Its rooms have been soundproofed, and offer elegant decor with a host of features including hair dryers, minibar, plasma TVs and Wi-Fi.

basicData.name: Astoria
basicData.title: Astoria
basicData.body: Opened in 1993, we are located in the old area of the city - one of the most beautiful parts of Madrid. We are within walking distance of many museums, palaces, churches and monuments as well as shops, restaurants, nightclubs and bars. The renowned Museo del Prado is located just 450 metres away. Over the years, the hostal has been revamped, and in 2006 we added 19 new rooms on our 4th floor. Boasting 45 rooms equipped with an ensuite bathroom, a hair dryer, TV, telephone, music, air conditioning and a safe, Astoria is an ideal hostal for both business trips and weekend get-aways. We also offer free Internet connection.

basicData.name: La Vera
basicData.title: La Vera
basicData.body:
This hostel is situated in a stately, historic building, belonging to the Dukes of Santoña. It has been newly renovated and its origins date back to the 19th century. A small, family business that has been open for more than 30 years. Welcoming staff and personal attention.

They offer comfortable and quiet rooms provided with complete bathroom –private or shared- TV and heating, decorated in a simple style yet with good taste. All of them have windows facing a big, calm and quiet patio. The building is equipped with a lift. Only the room is included in the price. However, you are given the possibility of having breakfast at their café, with the same name, just two minutes away from the hostel, in Atocha Street, with special prices for customers.

basicData.name: Hostal Alonso
basicData.title: Hostal Alonso
basicData.body: Hostel offering friendly service by the Puerta del Sol, just a few minutes from the city's big attractions. It has single rooms with free Wi-Fi connection, heating, flat screen TV, fan.

basicData.name: Americano
basicData.title: Americano
basicData.body: Hostel located right by the Puerta del Sol, a hot spot for the thousands of tourists that visit Madrid. From here, you can visit many of the city’s emblematic locations, such as the Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace, and the Opera House, and also enjoy restaurant and shopping areas in the centre of Madrid. It has 40 rooms, all with private bathroom and TV.

basicData.name: Residencia Universitaria Arti
basicData.title: Residencia Universitaria Arti
basicData.body: This is a university collage used as a hostel during summer months (July, August September). Its services are divided in two independent buildings and a big café-restaurant where also meetings, different activities and events can be organized. All facilities are in Plaza de España, a very good central location.

basicData.name: Triana
basicData.title: Triana
basicData.body: This hostel is superbly located in the historic, artistic and commercial centre of the city, between Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol, having a quick access to the most important tourist attractions (Museo del Prado, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real). In this ideal location you will enjoy a peaceful atmosphere, as the street where it is situated is very calm. Attentive and nice service.

basicData.name: Las Torres
basicData.title: Las Torres
basicData.body: Hostel located in the district of Las Letras, just a few minutes’ walk from the city’s major tourist spots: Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Cibeles and great museums such as the Prado, the Thyssen and the Reina Sofía. Its rooms come with television, telephone, heating, and air conditioning.

basicData.name: La Zona
basicData.title: La Zona
basicData.body:
This is a hostel for gay customers, located right in the centre of Madrid, very close to places like Gran Vía, Puerta del Sol and Chueca (Madrid’s gay district par excellence). From the hostel you can walk to the main tourist attractions (museums, monuments…), as well as to the hottest pubs.

It is managed by Vicent and Arnaldo, always worrying to make feel customers at home. A light and cosy place with a simple design. All rooms are exterior, with big balconies, complete bathroom and double bed or twin beds. Breakfast included: a rich buffet breakfast to stay strong the whole day.

basicData.name: Aeropuerto
basicData.title: Aeropuerto
basicData.body: Hostel located in the district of Barajas, very close to Madrid's Airport. It has 42 rooms, all equipped with television, telephone, and air conditioning. It also has a parking service and Wi-Fi connection for all guests.

basicData.name: Adriano
basicData.title: Adriano
basicData.body:
This hostel is located in an excellent place, right in the heart of Madrid, just 150 meters away from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Besides, it is also very close to other important points of tourist interest like Palacio and Teatro Real, Plaza Cibeles, the commercial area of Gran Vía, park of El Retiro, museums (El Prado, Reina Sofía and Thyssen Bornemisza) or the lively area of Chueca. You can go to all these places having a pleasant walk from the hostel.

All rooms (single, double, triple and quad) have undergone renovations in 2003, offering now light, comfortable and colourful spaces with a very personal interior decoration. Among them, you will find the room “María Callas”, in dedication to this opera singer.

basicData.name: Aguilar
basicData.title: Aguilar
basicData.body: This hostel has an excellent location, very close to Puerta del Sol and other leisure and cultural tourist attractions and activities. On the building, which has been renovated, the Círculo de Escritores Cinematográficos has installed a plaque commemorating the first cinema show in Spain which took place on Saint Isidore’s day (15th May) 1896.

basicData.name: Hostal Alegría
basicData.title: Hostal Alegría
basicData.body: Hostel located in the district of Arganzuela, with good links to the city’s main attractions: museums, shops, and restaurants. Its rooms come with a fully fitted bathroom, air conditioning, heating, television and free Wi-Fi.

basicData.name: Alfaro
basicData.title: Alfaro
basicData.body: Hostel located in the district of Las Letras, very close to Madrid’s major museums: the Prado, the Thyssen and the Reina Sofía, as well as other tourist attractions in the city such as the Parliament, the Plaza Mayor, and the Puerta del Sol. The hostel has recently been renovated and offers various services such as a lift, 24 hour reception, free Wi-Fi, fully fitted bathroom in the rooms, desk, air conditioning and heating, large wardrobes and LCD televisions.

basicData.name: Hostal Abami
basicData.title: Hostal Abami
basicData.body: Guesthouse located in Malasaña, just a stone´s throw away from the Gran Vía, offering easy access to the city´s main attractions. It has various amenities, such as Wi-Fi, lift, hairdryer, air conditioning, among others.

basicData.name: Hostal Abril
basicData.title: Hostal Abril
basicData.body: Guesthouse located in the lively and bustling Calle de Fuencarral, well known for its commercial district in which exclusive and designer shops are constantly being opened. The guesthouse is conveniently located for restaurants, theatres, cinemas and shops. It has recently been refurbished and offers comfortable rooms with en-suite bathroom, television, air conditioning and Wi-Fi connection.

basicData.name: Villamáñez
basicData.title: Villamáñez
basicData.body: This hostel is located opposite the Chamber of Deputies, in a very calm and pleasant area. It has spacious and light rooms, double or triple. Some of them are facing the garden of Palacio de Perinac, behind Lope de Vega’s house. Welcoming place and attentive service.

basicData.name: 4C Puerta Europa
basicData.title: 4C Puerta Europa
basicData.body:
In line with the other hotels in this chain, Hotel 4C Puerta de Europa stands in the Cuatro Caminos-Plaza Castilla axis. It is their farthest north location, at the foot of Torres KIO, which in reality are called Torres Puerta de Europa.

Hotel 4C Puerta Europa features a functional and modern decoration. Its 30 rooms have broadband Internet connection and are warmly furnished. They are also soundproof, isolating them from the noise of one of the busiest business areas in Madrid. Furthermore, the hotel also includes a private parking facility and a coffee shop serving breakfast.

basicData.name: Sancho
basicData.title: Sancho
basicData.body:
This hotel is named after the famous Cervantine character, once in La Mancha and now Madrid, just metres away from the Golden Triangle of Art formed by the Prado, the Reina Sofía and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums. Its connections are also excellent both by metro, with Delicias stop at the door of the hotel, and by train, since it is also close to Atocha railway station.

Unlike the inns and hostelries visited by Don Quixote in his adventures, this hotel features the latest technologies and comforts, such as the free wireless Internet connection in all of the rooms. Furthermore, the hotel has a private parking garage for guests who wish to use their own vehicle.

Aside from its spacious conference room for large social gatherings and business meetings, one of Hotel Sanchos major appeals is its ample solarium, where guests can enjoy the magnificent views of Madrids horizon from any of the deck chairs or easy chairs on the terrace, while sipping a drink served by the house bar.

basicData.name: Santander
basicData.title: Santander
basicData.body:
Through the doors of Hotel Santander, and throughout the years, thousands of visitors have passed and sojourned in the casual and cosy atmosphere of this small establishment, which, nonetheless, has plenty of stories to tell.

Founded in 1929, this building features a historical façade and a classical decor and is located in the heart of the Literary Quarter, in which the playwrights of the Spanish Golden Age of literature once lived. After taking a walk around this bohemian neighbourhood, culminating at the Prado, the Reina Sofía and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museums, tourists can choose to explore other sites of cultural interest near the capital. For that reason, Hotel Santander makes tours available for guests to cities such as Toledo, Segovia, El Escorial or Chinchón.

basicData.name: Gran Legazpi
basicData.title: Gran Legazpi
basicData.body:
Hotel Gran Legazpi opened its doors in 2004 on the square after which it is named, which is directly connected with and just a few metro stops away from the centric Puerta del Sol. It is also surrounded by new urban developments and residential complexes which lend this area, parallel to the bank of the Manzanares river, an air of peaceful modernity.

Its surroundings include major cultural centres, such as Matadero Madrid, a space dedicated to contemporary creativity whether it is in the shape of music, art performances or exhibitions. Also nearby is the Planetarium, a centre devoted to science and astronomy located close to Estación Sur de Autobuses in Méndez Álvaro. Furthermore, opposite the hotel, adventure-lovers will find shiuttle buses that will take them to the Warner Bros theme park.

Its completely soundproof rooms, some featuring panoramic views, are decorated with red marble from Alicante and Guinean wood furniture, creating a warm and cosy atmosphere. To start the day, nothing better than a tasty breakfast at the hotels coffee shop. There is also a rotisserie restaurant where the best pinchos and the dishes typical of Basque gastronomy can be savoured. For visitors who are in town for business, Hotel Gran Legazpi has a conference room available with everything necessary to ensure the meetings success, ranging from internet connection to a Business Centre including computers, fax and copying service.

basicData.name: Amaral
basicData.title: Amaral
basicData.body:
If you are looking for a peaceful stay in a cosy and comfortable yet sophisticated and elegant atmosphere, Hotel Amaral is a good option to look into. Built in 2006, this is a young and urban hotel in the Azca area, Madrid's financial district par excellence. It is located in a peaceful street, parallel to Paseo de la Castellana up by Plaza de Cuzco. This exclusive area in the capital is full of life both during the day, with all the shops in the adjacent busy streets, like Orense or Bravo Murillo, and at night, with the varied bars and clubs in the nearby Torre Europa or Avenida del Brasil. T

he hotel is open to holding all sorts of business events, making available for guests two conference rooms, which are also designed for private banquets and social gatherings. Its 126 rooms, 3 of which are handicapped accessible, are double rooms and are decorated paying special attention to detail. At Hotel Amaral's snack bar they serve all sorts of appetizers and a delicious breakfast buffet.

To work up an appetite, take a walk around the neighbourhood, to the mythical Santiago Bernabéu or the Palacio de Exposiciones y Congresos convention centre for instance, and survey the bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood, for every taste and every budget. After a good meal, nothing better than lying down on the deck chairs of the hotel garden, next to the outdoor swimming pool and surrounded by pine trees. There, you’ll get the feeling you’re no longer in the middle of a crowded city. For those who would rather burn out calories, the gym located across the street from the hotel features discounts for guests.

basicData.name: Acta Madfor
basicData.title: Acta Madfor
basicData.body:
Located in a natural yet urban environment, Hotel Acta Madfor is a good option to spend a few unforgettable days resting just minutes away from the city centre. On one side, across the Manzanares river, Casa de Campo, and on the other side, the gardens of the thousand-year-old Debod Temple and Parque del Oeste, neighbouring the centric Plaza de España. In between them is also Príncipe Pío Station, where thousands of Madrilenians from everywhere in the region make use of the numerous public transportation alternatives to make it to their destinations, or go shopping in the shopping centre located inside the station.

One of the major appeals of this hotel, built in the 60s and featuring a simple decor, is its closeness to San Antonio de la Floridas chapel. This is the third one of the chapels devoted to Saint Anthony of Padua, which was refurbished in the late 18th century and is particularly rich thanks to the paintings by the great Francisco de Goya. In this site, the hotel has everything necessary to make guests feel at home, ranging from parking facilities, a coffee shop and restaurant, to to the terrace-solarium with incredible views.

basicData.name: Aquaria Negresco
basicData.title: Aquaria Negresco
basicData.body:
Since 1949, Hotel Aquaria Negresco stands in a small street perpendicular to Gran Vía by Plaza de Callao. This cosy hotel has 19 harmoniously decorated rooms, renovated in 2002 and including, amongst other features, hydro-massage shower, free wireless Internet connection, king-size beds and double glass windows to ensure their guests rest. Visitors can also be sure to receive personalized attention, given the dimensions of the hotel.

Furthermore, the establishment provides guests with a living room with an LCD screen where they can follow the major sporting events as well as a computer with Internet access.

basicData.name: Moderno
basicData.title: Moderno
basicData.body:
On the corner of calle Arenal and the emblematic Puerta del Sol, a traditional Madrilenian 1936 building hosts what has been Hotel Moderno since 1955. Since then up until now, it has undergone numerous renovations in order to become one of the best options for a unique stay in the Spanish capital, whether travelling for business or tourism.

It is decorated in an elegant and traditional style peppered with contemporary touches, conveying a cosy feeling thanks to its hardwood floors. The hotel offers welcoming rooms, some of which feature spacious terraces offering incomparable views of the meeting point of thousands of locals and tourists who fill boutiques, tapas bars, restaurants and movie theatres in the old part of town.

Its central location should not deter travellers from using their car, since there are three parking facilities in just one block. Amongst other services, the hotel includes a shuttle service to the airport as well as a reservation service for restaurants, tours around the capital, day-trips to other interesting sites in the region, golf courses or car rental. It also offers ticket sales for flamenco shows, theatre plays and all the musicals playing on the neighbouring Gran Vía.

basicData.name: Don Luis
basicData.title: Don Luis
basicData.body:
Since 2003, Hotel Don Luis is a good option for travellers looking for comfortable and pleasant accommodation in the area surrounding Barajas International Airport, which is only one metro stop away on line 8, the same one that connects it to Nuevos Ministerios and Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I.

Its three storeys hold 38 cosy and fully-equipped rooms, featuring from satellite TV to Internet connection, all of it in a completely soundproof environment. The hotel also includes a conference rooms and a breakfast room. To make the best of their free time, guests can visit the nearby Olivar de la Hinojosa Golf Club, which, aside from the 18 holes for golf-lovers also has facilities in which they can practice tennis and paddle tennis, as well as a bar and a sauna in which to relax after playing.

basicData.name: Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto
basicData.title: Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto
basicData.body:
The renowned hotel chain Ibis opened in 2007 its space Madrid Aeropuerto to accommodate all those business travellers who need the comfort of having easy access to Adolfo Suárez-Barajas airport, which is hardly a kilometre away from the hotel.

The premises include a private parking facility for those who would rather travel in their own vehicle. It is also just a few minutes away from Recinto Ferial IFEMA, major trade fair and business trade shows in the city. The building houses a total of 163 functional rooms, equipped with Wi-Fi Internet connection amongst other things. At Hotel Ibis Madrid Aeropuerto, guests can make use of its 24-hour snack-bar and a restaurant serving a wide variety of Mediterranean cuisine dishes.

basicData.name: Francisco I
basicData.title: Francisco I
basicData.body:
From its balconies guests can admire the frantic activity that is characteristic of calle Arenal, which is nowadays a pedestrian street. Thanks to its prime location, added to the casual and personal treatment of its staff, Hotel Francisco I is a good option to keep in mind.

Carefully decorated, this is a unique place to enjoy a warm and cosy atmosphere, surrounded by the some of the oldest monuments in the city. Hotel Francisco I, , includes a coffee-shop which serves breakfast and rooms of different categories, renovated in 2010.

basicData.name: Caballero Errante
basicData.title: Caballero Errante
basicData.body:
Hotel Caballero Errante was built in February 2005 in a style that combines classical and modern elements. It is located in a quiet street just 100 metres away from Plaza de Castilla, near the bus interchange facility crowned by the monumental Torres KIO and Fundación Canal. The easy access to this hotel is completed by a subway stop just a few metres away and the busy Chamartín Station, which is 5 minutes away on foot.

Since the beginning, the hotel has equipped its facilities with the latest technologies. Its rooms have private outdoor areas and include free broadband Internet access and TV. Also available for guests is a private parking garage. Furthermore, the premises also feature a coffee shop and restaurant and a 300 square-metre terrace.

basicData.name: Europa
basicData.title: Europa
basicData.body:
Madrid at hand. This could well be the slogan for Hotel Europa, which is centrally located on calle del Carmen, a pedestrian street for those who wish to go shopping in their leisure time. Parallel to it, they will find the quintessential shopping street in the city: calle Preciados.

This is the setting for Hotel Europa, which maintains the classical style of the façades in the area and offers affordable rates for its 70 rooms some of which have views onto Puerta del Sol- and a range of services such as laundry, car rental, guided tours and day-trips. It also features a conference room for meetings, a arranged rates at a public parking garage and a coffee shop-restaurant specializing in Spanish gastronomy.

basicData.name: Ganivet
basicData.title: Ganivet
basicData.body:
The former Hotel Finisterre opened its doors in 1989, and, although it was renamed Hotel Ganivet in 2007, it has maintained their dedication to customer service yet updating their services offer, which ranges from free wireless Internet access to laundry and a private parking garage option, as well as a breakfast room, snack-bar and restaurant which welcomes group meals and adapts its menu to the customers requests.

 Hotel Ganviet five storeys host 146 rooms -140 of which are double rooms- behind its historical façade. Its major appeal is its location in the heart of the most traditional and genuine Madrid: at the end of calle Toledo, just steps away from the market in Puerta de Toledo and important sites and monuments such as the Church of San Francisco El Grande.

basicData.name: Room Mate Mario
basicData.title: Room Mate Mario
basicData.body:
Mario was the first one in Madrid to start the new hotel philosophy devised by entrepreneur Enrique Sarasola and his partners, Carlos Marrero, Eduardo Sanzol and Gorka Atorrasagasti. Based on affordable prices, they offer a casual and personal attention to guests -who are considered room mates- welcoming them warmly so that they feel as if they were staying at a friends house. Staying at Room Mate Mario means having a true sensory and aesthetic experience, inspired by the hip hotels in New York City, London and Paris.

The interior design, by Ángel Verdú, is innovative and minimalist, defined by geometrical lines, binary colours, few of which are dun, and indirect lighting, creating a cosy atmosphere. The interesting fact is that all of this sophistication is contained in an 1870 building right in the heart of Madrid. In line with the other roommates, Laura, Alicia and Óscar, Mario also lives in the core of the city, in the same building where the former hotel HH Campomanes was housed, just 50 metres away from the Royal Palace and Teatro Real.

Its rooms are spacious, warm and furnished with the trendiest interior design tendencies, with headboards by Tomás Alía and lamps by Phillip Starck, as well as being fully equipped with all the latest trends such as LCD screens and free Wi-Fi Internet access.

basicData.name: Concordy
basicData.title: Concordy
basicData.body:
Hotel Concordy, located 12 kilometres away on A-6 national road, in the incomparable setting extending around Monte de El Pardo, is an ideal choice for business travellers since the major multinational companies and business parks in the region are located along that road.

However, since 2005, coinciding with the reopening of La Zarzuela Racetrack, it has also become a perfect option for onlookers or visitors who hope to place their bet on the winning horse. Not in vain, in the back of this functional building, erected in 1997, is where the tracks and the other racetrack facilities are located. Aside from its 22 fully-equipped rooms that will ensure guests comfort, Hotel Concordy has a snack bar where they serve daily set menus Monday through Friday and meals and Mediterranean dishes on the weekend.

basicData.name: Di Carlo
basicData.title: Di Carlo
basicData.body:
Hotel Di Carlo is simple and functional, without relinquishing a unique location and a warm and cosy atmosphere. It comes as an alternative in the northern area of the city, within the metropolitan perimeter of the capital.

Just 300 metres away from the Plaza de Castilla junction, this modern four-storey building stands in a peaceful street off of busy calle Bravo Murillo. Thus, it is perfectly connected with the centre by metro and bus, as well as being easily accessible from the nearby Chamartín train station and just minutes away from Ifema trade fair grounds and Barajas airport by car.

Di Carlo is fully equipped with everything necessary to guarantee a pleasant stay, from Internet connection to a nearby parking garage arranged for guests, as well as an exquisite customer service, always readily available.

basicData.name: Neo Magna
basicData.title: Neo Magna
basicData.body:
Neo Magna is a young hotel with an international atmosphere. It is much more than a hotel; it offers comfort, fully equipped common areas, and a personalised, welcoming service. Furthermore, it has arrangements with the main leisure facilities allowing access to discounts, services and exclusive events.

And for those who wish to spend a longer stay in Madrid, Neo Magna offers a long-term accommodation service, like a student residence, with monthly rates.

basicData.name: NH Barajas
basicData.title: NH Barajas
basicData.body:
Considered an urban and business hotel, Hotel NH Barajas offers a wide range of services for travellers who prefer the comforts of staying in the vicinity of the Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas Airport and Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I. Another added perk is its easy accessibility, with a metro station right at the door providing direct connection with the city centreand a private parking facility.

Its modern facilities, distributed along the main building and the annex, are devised to provide executive guests with all the comforts during their sojourn, such as a PC business area offering computer rental services, the Internet corner or the conference room with audiovisual equipment and fax and copying services. Furthermore, at their restaurant Barajas, the hotel offers guests the possibility of enjoying healthy and balanced meals prepared with seasonal fresh produce, and washed down with wines

basicData.name: Hotel Plaza Mayor
basicData.title: Hotel Plaza Mayor
basicData.body:
Just one look at Hotel Plaza Mayor is enough to sense its historical value, since it is located in the former house of Church of Santa Cruz, demolished in 1875. On this same site the present construction was built on that same year, originally conceived as housing in the neoclassical style of the time.

The most traditional corners, from Plaza Mayor to Plaza de la Villa, through Puerta del Sol or Plaza de Tirso de Molina, are all in within few metres from the hotel. Respecting all this tradition and artistic and historical legacy, Hotel Plaza Mayor opened its doors in 1997 intending to become a referent for tourists who are looking to truly experience the deepest Madrilenian idiosyncrasy. For that reason, its 31 rooms, most of which have windows onto the street overlooking Austrias, are fully equipped with everything necessary to guarantee guests comfort and satisfaction. Suite del Palomar deserves a special mention. It is a pleasant and spacious room -over 40 square metres- located in the attic of the building. Its large and carefully decorated terrace offers guests the possibility of contemplating the spectacular views of the rooftops in the most genuine neighbourhood in the city.

basicData.name: Mora
basicData.title: Mora
basicData.body:
Thanks to its privileged location and affordable prices, Hotel Mora is an attractive option to spend a few days in the artistic and culture core of the city. It stands right on Paseo del Prado, opposite the Botanical Garden, just metres away from the Prado Museum, the Reina Sofía Art Centre and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, as well as El Retiro park.

Its five-storey building has important historical value, although due to a fire the old façade had to be restores, as well as the rest of facilities. Its closeness to Atocha station makes it a great choice for visitors arriving in Madrid by train. The premises include 62 rooms whose modern decor contrasts with the stately style of the common areas in the reception and living room. Also available to guests is its pleasant restaurant, serving a wide range of typical Spanish dishes. However, the area is also very inviting for tapas in the nearby Plaza de Santa Ana.

basicData.name: México
basicData.title: Mexico
basicData.body:
Hotel México is strategically located in the historical Literary Quarter, on a peaceful street around which guests will find the widest range of cultural offer in the city.

This 1950 building, featuring double-glass soundproof rooms, has undergone renovation in recent years. It is now a modern and contemporary space decorated with Aztec motives, radiating warmth and exoticism. Amongst its services, it is worth noting its private parking garage for visitors travelling with their own vehicle.

basicData.name: Mediodía
basicData.title: Mediodía
basicData.body:
Hotel Mediodía stands right in the heart of Glorieta de Carlos V, in a 1914 building erected following the aesthetics of French Neoclassicism.

Aside from its prime location, defined by the architectural grandeur and richness of nearby constructions, this hotel offers a wide range of features. Many of its rooms, spacious, bright and soundproof from the frantic activity that takes place every day in this square, also have the added perk of having balconies offering some of the most beautiful panoramic views of the city.

basicData.name: Isis
basicData.title: Isis
basicData.body:
Hotel Isis is a comfortable space located near the southern axis of the capital. It is well connected with the Estación Sur bus station in Mendéz Álvaro and the Planetarium both by metro and by car, since the M-30 bypass runs parallel to the Manzanares River bank. Also a short distance away is Parque de San Isidro, where the festivals honouring the patron saint of Madrid take place every year on May 15th.

Its premises house 82 spacious and comfortable rooms, both single and double rooms, a suite with a hydro-massage tub, a social room with capacity for 50 people, a parking garage and an annex for tall vehicles and, during the summer months, an outdoor sun deck from which guests can enjoy the beautiful views of the city. Furthermore, Hotel Isis includes a cosy restaurant decorated in a rustic and traditional style, in which delicious Spanish dishes are served daily.

basicData.name: Ibis Madrid Centro
basicData.title: Ibis Madrid Centro
basicData.body:
Hotel Ibis Madrid Centro Maravillas stands in the most youthful area of the old part of town, the Malasaña neighbourhood. This is the epicentre of Madrids nightlife since back in the 80s it was the setting to La Movida, a movement that represented a social, artistic and cultural revolution which defined a whole generation. Hence, this establishment founded in 2005 is an ideal choice for short weekend stays in which guests can explore what was the scene back then.

Amongst other services, Hotel Ibis Madrid Centro Maravillas offers functional rooms with free Wi-Fi Internet access, a nearby public parking garage and a 24-hour snack-bar.

basicData.name: Sterling
basicData.title: Sterling
basicData.body:
Hotel Alexandra is housed in a seven-storey building, erected in 1954 in the centric calle San Bernardo. Renewed in 1999, the space became a modern establishment with pleasant rooms, some of which have a terrace. The rooms have everything necessary to ensure that guests have a good night sleep after a long day shopping and enjoying the many entertainment options in the nearby Gran Vía.

The hotel also offers the spaces Alexis I and Alexis II, which can be used for conferences and meetings, both of them equipped with the necessary multimedia technology. Amongst other services, Hotel Alexandra offers laundry and medical attention, serves breakfast in a spacious dining room and has arranged meals with the neighbouring restaurant El Pajar, which serves Castilian cuisine. There, guests can enjoy a daily set menu as well as delicious traditional dishes, such as Castilian soup, or choose from their wide range of red meats and fish.

basicData.name: Hotel Asturias
basicData.title: Hotel Asturias
basicData.body:
Hotel Asturias stands on a corner of Plaza de Canalejas, bordering Puerta del Sol on one side and Plaza de las Cortes on the other side, where the Chamber of Deputies stands. This historical building, designed in 1870, displays great architectural beauty.

Aside from its artistic charm, it offers a wide range of features for a hotel of its class. As well as its fully-equipped rooms, the hotel facilitates guided tours and day-trips, car rental service and ticket services for soccer games and other shows. The premises also include a coffee shop and a restaurant in which guests can taste healthy Mediterranean cuisine both in their daily set menus or their à la carte dishes.

basicData.name: 4C Bravo Murillo
basicData.title: 4C Bravo Murillo
basicData.body:
Hotel 4C Bravo Murillo opened its doors in 2006 in line with the philosophy of this hotel chain: creating comfortable and pleasant spaces in the heart of the city. Thus, this modern building stands between Plaza de Castilla and Glorieta de Cuatro Caminos, with a metro stop right at the door, providing easy access to the stops in Sol and Gran Vía and just a short walk away from the business and financial area in Azca.

Every one of its 92 rooms is equipped with high-speed Internet access and 26-inch plasma TV, and is designed to provide guests with the maximum comfort and rest. They feature 6-foot long beds which come in different widths as wells as a soundproof system that isolates the room from the outside noise coming from the busy calle Bravo Murillo. This multiracial and intercultural artery combines the most traditional stores with the boutiques showcasing the latest trends. Amongst other services, the hotel has a private parking garage and a conference room, both free to guests.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Ducal Chueca
basicData.title: Petit Palace Ducal Chueca
basicData.body:
Petit Palace Ducal is the perfect choice for lovers of new trends for its atmosphere and for being a meeting point for celebrities and artists of all sorts. It is located in the Chueca neighbourhood, the most cosmopolitan area in the city.

This hotel boutique has combined past and present, creating a space which is very much in line with the times and the area. The background comes with the building, a former palace built in the late 19th century on the corner of Gran Vía and close to the surrounding monuments. The rest is attained through a minimalist decor, functional and innovative, as well as the latest technology and the feel that comes from this particular central location in the Chueca and Gran Vía area.

basicData.name: NH Práctico
basicData.title: NH Práctico
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Práctico is the perfect choice for business travellers who are in town for work in the area surrounding Paseo de la Castellana, the major business and financial district in the capital.

The hotel is located by Plaza de Castilla, near Chamartín Station, and is well-connected with Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I, and Palacio Municipal de Congresos and Barajas airport. This three-star hotel offers a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere as well as a modern and functional decor, in which wood and blue tones are predominant.

basicData.name: Miau
basicData.title: Miau
basicData.body:
Its location, in Plaza de Santa Ana, is the best of Hotel Miau's features. The Literary Quarter is one of the most charming neighbourhoods in the city, with plenty to offer both during the day and at night. On the one hand, it is surrounded the major museums, a great number of art galleries, a long list of trendy venues, traditional bars and the main tourist sites. And when the night comes, this square and its neighbouring streets become one of the hot spots of Madrids nightlife.

The other major appeal is the building where it is housed, with a neoclassical façade displaying outstanding wrought iron balustrades, which have been preserved since the 19th century. In all other aspects, Hotel Miau is a modest yet cosy three-star hotel, ideal for visitors who whish to explore the city and its atmosphere.

basicData.name: Best Western Los Condes
basicData.title: Best Western Los Condes
basicData.body:
One of Hotel Best Western Los Condess major perks is its prime location. It stands right in the heart of Madrid, yet removed from noises, since it is located in on of the streets originating in Gran Vía, famous for being filled with bookshops.

It also has a family atmosphere, probably because it is a small and cosy hotel, and provides guests with a cultural, tourist and entertainment offer like no other just by stepping out the door. The early 19th-century building in which it is housed is protected and classified as having historical interest, very much in line with the style of building in the city centre.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Tres Cruces
basicData.title: Petit Palace Tres Cruces
basicData.body:
Despite occupying an early 20th century building, Petit Palace Tres Cruces is a very modern hotel that opened in 2006.

This three-star hotel offers the latest technology and very contemporary and functional decor, and is a good option for both couples with children and executives. Its prime location is one of its strong points, as it stands right in the heart of Madrid, on the corner of Gran Vía. From this privileged spot, visitors can explore the city’s historical and monumental centre as well as a long list of trendy shops, restaurants and venues, all of which are only a few metres away, ideal for a pleasurable stay in Madrid.

basicData.name: Acis y Galatea
basicData.title: Acis y Galatea
basicData.body:
This hotel is inspired by the myth in Handel’s opera Acis and Galatea, and is in a residential area close to the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair Complex (IFEMA). It caters for people needing to spend the night in Madrid waiting for a flight connection; in town for business or attending any of the many trade fairs held at IFEMA.

Occupying a modern building shaped like a white cube, The philosophy at Hotel Acis y Galatea is far from that of large hotel chains. It offers a reduced number of rooms, each one of them decorated to reflect the latest interior design trends, with large canvases on the walls, some featuring striped patterns and others depicting the myths after which the hotel is named.

basicData.name: NH Argüelles
basicData.title: NH Argüelles
basicData.body:
NH Argüelles is a three-star hotel recommended for all kinds of travellers, especially for families with children who are in town to explore the city and who are looking for a quiet area where they can rest after a long day of sightseeing.

The hotel is named after the neighbourhood in which it is located. Its surroundings include Calle Bravo Murillo, the La Abadía and Galileo theatres and the shopping area on Calle Princesa. The University campus and Plaza de España are also just a short distance away.

basicData.name: AC Avenida de América
basicData.title: AC Avenida de América
basicData.body:
Hotel AC Avenida de América is a modern, functional and well-connected hotel, next to Avenida de America transport interchange facility, one of the city’ major communication junctions.

Its location makes it a good choice for all types of travellers, since it has easy access to both the financial district and the historical and monumental part of town. Plus, the hotel restaurant is well-known for its excellent menu, focusing on traditional Spanish cooking.

basicData.name: NH Balboa
basicData.title: NH Balboa
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Balboa’s major appeal is their ‘Nhube’ space, a concept combining leisure and dining designed by Ferran Adrià. The chef has created a multifunctional space, very much in line with the taste of business travellers, who make up a large proportion of the hotel’s customers.

‘Nhube’ is a restaurant and reading room as well as a lounge and café-bar. It has a modern and flexible atmosphere thanks to the way the light changes depending on the time of day and the designer furniture. Hotel NH Balboa, in the heart of the Salamanca District, is an ideal choice for people wanting to explore the most exclusive and distinguished area of the city, where they will find all the major fashion brands.

basicData.name: NH Bretón
basicData.title: NH Bretón
basicData.body:
Nh Bretón is the perfect choice for business travellers who need a place to stay and rest after a long working day. This three-star hotel prides itself on its peaceful and cosy atmosphere.

It is located in the Nuevos Ministerios and Azca area, by Paseo de la Castellana, the city’s main business and financial district. It is also very well connected to the Juan Carlos I trade fair complex and the Palacio Municipal de Congresos convention centre, an area in which there are also plenty of leisure options.

basicData.name: NH Lagasca
basicData.title: NH Lagasca
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Lagasca is surrounded by luxury and exclusiveness on every side. It is located in the heart of the Salamanca neighbourhood, an upmarket area where all the international fashion firms are based.

This three-star hotel is a good option for travellers wanting to explore the most sophisticated area and shop for the most exclusive fashion or for executives who want to relax after work in a hotel near the city’s financial district but in a quiet spot.

basicData.name: NH Pacífico
basicData.title: NH Pacífico
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Pacífico is, above all, very well connected, as it is near the M-30 motorway and very close to Estación Sur bus station in Méndez Álvaro and Atocha Station.

Based in a modern building, NH Pacífico offers an interior in which comfort and functionality are predominant, and where wood is a key element in the interior decor.

basicData.name: NH Atocha
basicData.title: NH Atocha
basicData.body:
NH Atocha is a very well connected three-star hotel, located between Estación Sur bus station and Atocha Station.

All of the gems in the artistic and monumental Madrid are just a few steps away from the hotel, although for those who would rather explore the city from a different perspective, the hotel provides guests with a bicycle rental service. Travellers wanting to get a different view of Madrid and be healthy and environmentally-friendly at the same time are the perfect guests for this hotel.

basicData.name: NH Zurbano
basicData.title: NH Zurbano
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Zurbano is the perfect choice for families visiting Madrid and wanting to spend a few leisurely days in the capital, as the hotel caters especially for children. It is also ideal for business travellers who are in Madrid for a short trip and need to have everything within easy reach so as to make the most of their stay.

This three-star hotel has many benefits, including its location, right in the heart of the business and financial district, near Paseo de la Castellana and close to the Azca complex. Its proximity to Nuevos Ministerios means there is excellent access to the airport. The hotel also has several conference rooms for all sorts of events, and is just a few metres away from the Palacio de Congresos de Castellana convention centre, and a few metro stops away from the Juan Carlos I trade fair complex and the Palacio Municipal de Congresos conference centre.

basicData.name: Ópera
basicData.title: Ópera
basicData.body:
Opera lovers find the perfect accommodation in Hotel Ópera. On the one hand it is just a few metres away from Teatro Real, the city’s opera coliseum par excellence. On the other hand, the hotel is true to its name and offers its famous “sung dinners”, in which the waiting staff serve delicious food and the best selection of arias, duos, quartets and romances from the most famous operas and zarzuelas.

The hotel decor is classic, with a lot of marble and vintage furniture, very much in line with its surroundings: the historical Madrid of the Hapsburgs and the most romantic part of the city. If you fancy swapping this setting for a more cosmopolitan scene, Gran Vía is just steps away.

basicData.name: Osuna
basicData.title: Osuna
basicData.body:
Despite being located in one of the most significant business areas in Madrid, Hotel Osuna is more like a holiday resort than a hotel in a major city. This is due to its outdoor swimming-pool, surrounded by bungalows, very much in line with a holiday paradise hotel. It also has a terrace and elegant, traditional-style decor.

On the whole, this four-star hotel is a good choice for families looking for a quiet place to enjoy their free time. However, its location, close to the Juan Carlos I trade fair complex and Barajas Airport, also makes it an ideal option for business travellers visiting the city for work. For them, the hotel includes a business centre and, after a long day of work, they can either enjoy the pool or the golf course next to the hotel.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Arenal
basicData.title: Petit Palace Arenal
basicData.body:
Petit Palace Arenal is the perfect choice for people wanting to explore the most traditional side of Madrid without renouncing the comforts of a modern hotel with an innovative designer atmosphere.

This hotel boutique is ideal for guests looking for all the major discos, lounge bars, shops, restaurants, tapas bars and theatres. Centrally located in one of the capital’s grandest streets, it stands opposite the church of San Ginés, close to Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Isabel II, and behind Las Descalzas convent. The building is also an interesting feature in its own right, as it is a historical property that still preserves its original structure and impressive cellar, now used as breakfast room and business centre.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Italia
basicData.title: Petit Palace Italia
basicData.body:
Petit Palace Italia is an ideal choice for families visiting Madrid, its museums, monuments, shops, theatres or restaurants, since it is centrally located, on the corner of Gran Vía.

Couples with children will find this three-star hotel ideal, as the family rooms are furnished with bunk beds so children can sleep with their parents, plus children under 12 stay for free. Nonetheless, the hotel also keeps the business traveller in mind, with a series of specially tailored rooms. Petit Palace Italia is based in the city centre in an early 20th-century building that accurately represents the architecture of the time, and whose original façade has been preserved. The interior, however, is different, with modern decor in an elegant contemporary style with a predominance of dark furniture and hardwood floors. As with all others in the same chain, the hotel prides itself on being equipped with the very latest technology.

basicData.name: NH Alberto Aguilera
basicData.title: NH Alberto Aguilera
basicData.body:
NH Alberto Aguilera is comfortable, modern hotel, ideal for exploring the busy Spanish capital for its proximity to the main bus and metro routes.

Its prime location, near the impressive Plaza de España, a wonderful example of classic Spanish architecture, and Gran Vía. In addition to its excellent location, it also offers two meeting rooms next door to one another in a quiet part of the hotel.

basicData.name: Hotel Avenida Gran Vía
basicData.title: Hotel Avenida Gran Vía
basicData.body:
Hotel Avenida Gran Vía is surrounded by theatres, cinemas, departments stores and restaurants, as well as being extremely well connected to the city’s metro and bus routes.

The individually decorated modern rooms are fully equipped to ensure guests feel completely at home. This makes it the ideal accommodation choice for business travellers and for people wanting to explore the city.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Cliper Gran Vía
basicData.title: Petit Palace Cliper Gran Vía
basicData.body:
Conveniently located on Gran Vía, and featuring rooms equipped with bunk beds and cribs, Petit Palace Cliper Gran Vía is an ideal choice for families visiting the city for shopping or for enjoying any of the many shows in the area, known as Madrid’s Broadway.

The hotel occupies a centrally located 1940s building that showcases Madrid’s typical post-war architecture. Its interior, on the other hand, is equipped with the very latest in technology and design, with contemporary details such as workout bikes and hydro-massage showers in every room and wireless internet connection throughout the building. Photography plays a significant role at the Petit Palace Cliper Gran Vía. The hotel displays the work of both acclaimed and up-and-coming artists on the walls of its lounges and public areas.

basicData.name: Anaco
basicData.title: Anaco
basicData.body:
Its prime location on a street that runs perpendicular to Gran Vía makes Hotel Anaco an ideal choice for visitors who are in town for a few days.

You can’t hear the hustle and bustle of the street inside the hotel, as it has 39 fully soundproof rooms with double glazed windows. The parking issue is solved by the neighbouring 24-hour parking garage, which has an agreement with the hotel. However, the best way to access the hotel is by public transport, either by metro, with Gran Vía station almost in front of the main entrance, or by bus, with any of the numerous lines converging on Red de San Luis. The hotel features a cosy snack bar and restaurant.

basicData.name: Ateneo
basicData.title: Ateneo
basicData.body:
Aside from its privileged location, Hotel Ateneo de Madrid is housed in a building with an important historical background. It was designed by Ventura Rodríguez, who was appointed architect and draftsman of royal constructions by Ferdinand VI, and author of emblematic works such as Palacio de Liria or the chapel at the Royal Palace, as well as being a painter.

Over two centuries later, Hotel Ateneo is a modern urban hotel founded in 2003 and located in the heart of Madrid, on the junction of Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol. Its spacious and well-lit rooms have everything necessary to ensure a comfortable stay. Plaza Mayor, Cibeles, the Royal Palace and the Sabatini gardens or Hapsburg Madrid are only a few of the sights just minutes away from the hotel. At night, only a few metres away, the atmosphere invites night owls to explore any of the bars and clubs that make Madrid’s nightlife like no other.

basicData.name: Atlántico
basicData.title: Atlántico
basicData.body:
The most striking feature of Hotel Atlántico is the building housing it, located right on Gran Vía and which can be compared to other emblematic buildings such as Casino de Madrid or the Ritz and Palace hotels.

It is an early 20th-century building by Joaquín Saldaña y López, showcasing an eclectic style and French influences. The decor includes a set of columns, pilasters, temperas and vases, crowned with a tower and a French-style dome, as well as the frontispiece which once displayed the coat of arms of its first owner, the Marquis of Falces. The interior features individually decorated rooms with a unique atmosphere.

basicData.name: Best Western Carlos V
basicData.title: Best Western Carlos V
basicData.body:
Hotel Best Western Carlos V is an ideal choice for visitors in Madrid for shopping, sightseeing or to see any of the theatre shows. It is located between Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol, on Calle Preciados, which is a pedestrian street packed with shops.

The hotel features a classic decor, with elements such as suits of armour and wood panelling in the living rooms. On the first floor, guests can relax in the games room and play board games. They can also make use of the free high-speed Internet access.

basicData.name: Best Western Hotel Trafalgar
basicData.title: Best Western Hotel Trafalgar
basicData.body:
Hotel Best Western Trafalgar is halfway between the historic, artistic and monument area in Madrid and the financial district. This means it is ideal for all kinds of travellers visiting Madrid for business or for tourism and looking for a simple and discreet hotel. This is also a good choice for people wanting to experience the most underground and transgressive environment of Calle Fuencarral and the Malasaña neighbourhood.

The goal of this three-star hotel is to become a second home to its guests. Their secret for this is providing them with a cosy atmosphere and personalized service, which is something that often only small hotels can offer.

basicData.name: Best Western Hotel Villa de Barajas
basicData.title: Best Western Hotel Villa de Barajas
basicData.body:
Hotel Best Western Hotel Villa de Barajas is a perfect choice for visitors who are in town for business, to attend trade fairs or conventions, or travellers who have a stopover in Madrid for a flight connection. What all of them have in common is the need for a simple yet cosy hotel where they can rest after a long day.

Recently renovated, this modern three-star hotel is strategically located close to Barajas Airport as well as the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair complex (IFEMA) and the Palacio Municipal de Congresos convention centre.

basicData.name: Casón del Tormes
basicData.title: Casón del Tormes
basicData.body:
In the shadow of the 142 metre-high Torre de Madrid and the 117 metre-tall Edificio España, two of the most symbolic buildings in the city, is Hotel Casón del Tormes, a pleasant and modest space located in a peaceful street in the vicinity of the centrally-located Plaza de España.

The hotel rooms, are all soundproofed with double-glazed windows and overlook this emblematic square. Since this is also a financial area, Hotel Casón del Tormes, which opened in 2003, is a good alternative for business tourism, with a spacious social room and Wi-Fi Internet connection.

Los Madroños breakfast room serves a daily breakfast buffet daily starting at 7:30 am. The variety of bars and restaurants in the city centre provide guests with a range of options to choose from for lunch and dinner.

basicData.name: Reyes Católicos
basicData.title: Reyes Católicos
basicData.body:
Right in the heart of Hapsburg Madrid, surrounded by the best taverns and tapas bars in the city, Hotel Reyes Católicos occupies a prime location. It is well connected by public transport, with the nearby La Latina and Puerta de Toledo metro stations, and also convenient for guests with cars, as it has a private garage to take the stress out of parking.

Its five floors house informally decorated rooms that are also equipped with innovative features such as interactive TV, videogames and Internet access. The rooms on the top floor have spectacular views of San Francisco el Grande, a former Franciscan convent converted into a basilica and which has the largest dome in Madrid, measuring 33 metres in diameter. All rooms are soundproofed with double glazed windows.

basicData.name: Claridge
basicData.title: Claridge
basicData.body:
Overlooking Plaza de Conde de Casal, the Claridge opened its doors in 1967 in the Retiro district, one of the capital’s most dynamic and representative neighbourhoods.

This boutique hotel achieved four-star status after being fully refurbished in 2012. Special attention has been paid to interior decoration, where American and classical British touches can be seen, creating an exquisite personalised and sophisticated atmosphere. Part of the hotel’s charm is its Madrid 2.0 collection of photographs by artist Gerard Franquesa, which use the graphite technique.

basicData.name: Dos Castillas
basicData.title: Dos Castillas
basicData.body:
Built in 1994, Hotel II Castillas has comfortable, bright and airy rooms, some of which have spacious terraces with unique views of the old part of town.

It is decorated in a comfortable and functional style, with a very cosy feel thanks to its hardwood floors. Every morning the abundant breakfast buffet is served in the refined yet simple breakfast room. Its snack bar, with large windows letting in the natural light, is the ideal spot to taste some of the best traditional dishes, served from both the à la carte and the daily set menus. The space is also available for all kinds of events and celebrations, from business meals to banquets, weddings and social gatherings.

basicData.name: Eurostars Zarzuela Park
basicData.title: Eurostars Zarzuela Park
basicData.body:
Hotel Zarzuela Park is part of the prestigious hotel chain Eurostars and named after nearby Hipódromo de la Zarzuela, the horse racing track that was re-opened in 2005 after being closed for nine years. The hotel rooms are spread over three stately buildings, a main block and two annexes, surrounded by gardens, a swimming-pool and two paddle courts. It is located in the northern area of Madrid, Aravaca, with good connections to Moncloa by bus, and it is also near other towns such as Pozuelo de Alarcón, Majadahonda and Las Rozas.

The area around the hotel includes Monte de El Pardo, a unique wooded parkland filled with holm oaks which surrounds the middle course of the Manzanares river and was formerly a private game preserve for Spanish royalty. Zarzuela Park is in a beautiful setting that respects the environmental richness of the site and combines it with the latest technology and modern facilities. Aside from its spacious areas for all kinds of events, the hotel restaurant, El Mirador, has an excellent reputation. Every night guests can enjoy dishes prepared with seasonal produce and based on Mediterranean, Provençal and Castilian cuisine.

basicData.name: Hesperia Hermosilla
basicData.title: Hesperia Hermosilla
basicData.body:
Hotel Hesperia Hermosilla is housed in a classical building, conveniently located just a few metres away from Cibeles fountain and Atocha train station. It is also close to the shopping area and the financial district, as well as to the major museums and El Retiro Park, what makes it a good choice for all sorts of guests.

Rooms are fully equipped with everything needed to make your visit comfortable. For those travellers who are in town for business, there is business centre available.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Puerta del Sol
basicData.title: Petit Palace Puerta del Sol
basicData.body:
Petit Palace Puerta del Sol is one of those hotels offering a modern atmosphere in a very traditional and typical environment. The hotel occupies a mid-19th century building that blends perfectly with its surroundings on Calle Arenal on the corner with Sol and is decorated in an innovative style with rooms featuring the latest technology and interior design trends.

Families visiting Madrid to explore the most authentic side of the city and business travellers will find this three-star hotel to be an ideal choice. They can all count on rooms being tailored to their needs, some with bunk beds so children can sleep with their parents and others equipped with everything necessary for the business guest. The bedrooms also feature small luxuries such as the latest hydro-massage showers.

basicData.name: Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
basicData.title: Ibis Styles Madrid Prado
basicData.body:
All of the Designations of Origin of Spanish wines await you at this themed hotel. Andalusia on the first floor, Castile La Mancha and the Levante region on the second floor, the Canary and Balearic Islands on the third floor, Catalonia on the fourth floor, followed by Galicia and Aragon on the fifth floor, Castile and Leon, Navarre and Vizcaya on the sixth floor, and to cap it all, wines from Madrid, on the seventh and top floor of this building located in the cultural epicentre of the city, near the Prado, Reina Sofía and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums.

All rooms have free Wi-Fi internet access and satellite TV. Each one of them is individually decorated with photographs from the different areas of the Designation of Origin they represent. The most international of all, La Rioja, has its own space in the Reading Room.

Also geared towards business tourism, the hotel features two conference rooms, Rioja and Salón Prensa del Vino, which guests will find ideal for reading the newspaper, watching TV or contemplating any of the numerous items connected with the wine industry that are on display.

basicData.name: Travelodge Torrelaguna
basicData.title: Travelodge Torrelaguna
basicData.body: Travelodge Torrelaguna is, above all, a functional hotel. This three-star hotel proposes what theyve called Travelodgic: is a concept that consists in eliminating the small, unnecessary luxuries so as to have guests pay less and only for what is truly necessary. It could be considered a low cost hotel. Located in the Arturo Soria business area, the ideal guests in this hotel are business travellers who need a place to stay and are looking for a practical solution.

basicData.name: Cortezo
basicData.title: Cortezo
basicData.body:
The most traditional and cultural Madrid spreads out on all sides of Hotel TRH Cortezo, a historical construction built in 1958 and completely renovated.

Its guests can have the privilege of staying in any of its comfortably equipped rooms, featuring hardwood floors and warm lights that ensure a cosy stay. A parking garage and a shuttle service to and from Barajas Airport guarantee a trip free of transportation hassles. An English-style bar and a restaurant offering Mediterranean cuisine complete the varied range of services in this establishment, which on Sunday faces the many other options for pinchos and tapas in the busy area of El Rastro street market.

basicData.name: Victoria 4
basicData.title: Victoria 4
basicData.body:
If there is one thing that makes Hotel Victoria 4 unique, aside from its centric location, it is the wise combination of original elements from the five-storey, 1850 building where it is housed, and the latest and most innovative interior design and cutting-edge technologies both in its 52 rooms and in the common areas.

Similarly, it prides to be home to the legendary Café Levante, meeting point of the great names of literature, namely the Generation of 98, during the golden period of cafés in Madrid, in the 50s. The bohemian atmosphere of yesteryear still remains in a space where guests can enjoy the most typical dishes of our regional gastronomy, such as Madrilenian cocido and a wide range of tapas, and others traditional of Spanish cuisine like paella and roasted lamb. Its terrace deserves a special mention: a taste of the most traditional Madrid, adjacent to Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Santa Ana, and also very close to Plaza Mayor and Plaza de las Cortes, where the Chamber of Deputies stands.

basicData.name: Tryp Madrid Washington
basicData.title: Tryp Madrid Washington
basicData.body:
Located in the heart of Gran Vía, this is the major appeal of this three-star hotel, which is an ideal choice for tourists who are visiting the capital and wish to go sightseeing, shopping or enjoy Madrid's nightlife.

Families with children have a special place in this hotel. Tryp Washington has taken them into account greatly, and has equipped some of its rooms with bunk beds so that the little ones and their parents can share a room.

basicData.name: Rex
basicData.title: Rex
basicData.body:
Hotel Rex is an ideal choice for visitors who wish to explore the city from within and enjoy its cultural and entertainment offer, given its location on Gran Vía, which is one of the citys liveliest arteries. It is also a good option for those who would like to discover the most artistic and monumental side of Madrid.

Decorated in a classical style, reminiscent of the Roman Empire, its rooms boast something that few others can offer: views onto Gran Vía.

basicData.name: Infanta Mercedes
basicData.title: Infanta Mercedes
basicData.body: Hotel Tryp Infanta Mercedes is a good choice for both those travelling for pleasure and for work, since it is located by Paseo de la Castellana, an important shopping and business area where many of the major companies have their offices. It is also well connected to the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I trade fair park and to Barajas airport. Amongst it services it features Wi-Fi Internet connection throughout the hotel and a conference room with capacity for 50 people.

basicData.name: Tryp Madrid Gran Vía
basicData.title: Tryp Madrid Gran Vía
basicData.body:
Hotel Tryp Gran Vía is a perfect choice for visitors who are travelling for pleasure, whether exploring the artistic and monumental side of Madrid or spending a few days shopping and enjoying the entertainment offer.

 Its major perk is its location. Step outside and find the most cosmopolitan and modern side of Madrid, with a never-ending range of shops, restaurants, theatres, bars and nightclubs. In its surroundings, just steps away, the Golden Triangle of Art, Hapsburg Madrid or the Literary Quarter. It is the perfect location to discover Madrid both during the day and at night.

basicData.name: Tryp Madrid Chamberí
basicData.title: Tryp Madrid Chamberí
basicData.body:
Tryp Madrid Chamberí is a three-star hotel that suits all sorts of guests, ranging from business travellers who are in town for work in the financial district along La Castellana, to visitors coming to any of the events held at Palacio de Congresos, as well as fans who are here to watch a Real Madrid game, or those who wish to go sightseeing or enjoy the entertainment the capital has to offer.

The hotel is located right in the heart of the Chamberí neighbourhood, between the old part of town and the citys business area. Its interior features a peaceful and comfortable atmosphere, with a classical decoration in which warm colours are predominant.

basicData.name: Tryp Madrid Chamartín
basicData.title: Tryp Madrid Chamartín
basicData.body:
Tryp Madrid Chamartínis a three-star hotel for executives who are in town for work and wish to rest in a peaceful area. It is also ideal for couples with children. Furthermore, their facilities include a swimming pool that delights the little ones in the summer as well as allowing adults a little rest and a sunbath. The pool also has a solarium.

 The hotel is located in the residential area by Plaza de Castilla, close to the Chamartín train station and well connected with the financial district on Paseo de la Castellana. It also has easy access to the Juan Carlos I trade fair grounds and the Municipal Convention Centre.

basicData.name: T3 Tirol
basicData.title: T3 Tirol
basicData.body:
The former Hotel Tirol, erected in 1954, is now a modern space owned by the hotel chain T3, dedicated exclusively to three-stars hotels. They renovated the building, committed to preserving the warm and cosy atmosphere of its predecessor, but with contemporary touches that remove this hotel from the cold and aseptic establishment in its class.

T3 Tirol stands in a prime location, between Moncloa and Plaza de España, just metres away from the cable car that connects the city centre with Casa de Campo. This is the stately Argüelles neighbourhood, which nonetheless has a young atmosphere thanks to the students who choose this area due to its closeness to Ciudad Universitaria. Opposite the hotel there is a large shopping centre and calle Princesa, filled with boutiques and movie theatres.

The hotel offers great quality for the price, featuring all sorts of services for individuals and business travellers, such as rooms that include voice and data connections, aside from regular services. Its Business Centre provides broadband Internet connection, high-resolution scanner, colour printer and computers, amongst others. They also have a social room for family events and another two rooms in different sizes for conventions. A parking garage and a coffee shop/dining room complete the comforts to which the T3 chain is committed.

basicData.name: Silken Torre Garden
basicData.title: Silken Torre Garden
basicData.body:
Silken Torre Garden offers spacious, bright and quiet rooms for every type of traveller, whether it is tourists who would rather distance themselves from the hustle and bustle of the city or travellers who are in town for business.

Its main advantage is that it is located between the airport and the city centre, so it suits all sorts of guests. Its decor features wood, light colours and natural light. All of its spacious rooms have exterior windows and are divided into two spaces: bedroom and living room.

basicData.name: Puerta de Toledo
basicData.title: Puerta de Toledo
basicData.body:
Hotel Puerta de Toledo is a good option for travellers who wish to explore the Rastro, get lost in the streets filled with stands and discover the typical Madrilenian gastronomy, served in local barns and taverns.

Located opposite Puerta de Toledo, after which it is named, it is the perfect base for a typically traditional plan. And for those who are in town for San Isidro, Hotel Puerta de Toledo might be an ideal choice, since it is halfway between Las Vistillas park and San Isidro Prairie. This is where the most popular festivals are held, in the heart of a celebration with plenty of historical background.

basicData.name: Holiday Inn Madrid-Pirámides
basicData.title: Holiday Inn Madrid-Pirámides
basicData.body:
The natural light that comes in through its large windows is one of the main features of Rafael Pirámides. This three-star hotel is located next to Vicente Calderón stadium, on the Manzanares riverbank, hence an ideal choice for Atlético de Madrid fans who are in town for a match.

Before or after the match, or for those who are not so interested in football, the hotel’s location allows visitors to explore all aspects of the city: the most authentic and typical side of Madrid around El Rastro; the artistic part of town on the Art Walk; the historical buildings in Hapsburg Madrid and the city’s most cosmopolitan area, the centre.

basicData.name: Rafael Hoteles Ventas
basicData.title: Rafael Hoteles Ventas
basicData.body:
Rafael Hoteles Ventas is a modern hotel located in a very traditional area, on Calle Alcalá. Its surroundings include Las Ventas bullring, which is one of the hotel’s major appeals, especially during the bullfighting season and particularly during the festival of Madrid’s patron saint San Isidro.

The hotel has excellent connections with the historic city centre and its monuments on one side and the business and financial district on the other. The hotel displays a large collection of paintings, which are highlighted by a classic traditional decor featuring patterns and prints in brown tones and light colours.

basicData.name: Regente
basicData.title: Regente
basicData.body:
The ten storeys of this stately building dating back to 1951 contain fully refurbished rooms, some of which have magnificent views of this busy part of the city, packed with shops and entertainment.

Perhaps for this reason, the hotel staff will gladly provide you with their advanced ticket sale service for theatre plays, musicals and dance shows, bullfights or flamenco shows in any of the numerous theatres in nearby Gran Vía. For guests who have already explored the city centre, Hotel Regente organizes full guided tours led by a tourism official through other major tourist sites in the surrounding cities, such as El Escorial, Alcalá de Henares, Ávila, Segovia and Toledo.

Hotel facilities include a coffee shop where guests can enjoy a varied continental breakfast, a parking garage, a conference room and car rental service.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Londres
basicData.title: Petit Palace Londres
basicData.body:
