Petit Palace Londres offers a real treat not within everyone’s reach, which is seeing the clock in Puerta del Sol striking midnight on New Year’s Eve from the window of your own room. The hotel is surrounded by Plaza Mayor, Ópera, the Art Triangle and Gran Vía, other treats that can be enjoyed all year round.

The building occupied by the hotel adds to its attractiveness as it is a former palace built in the early 20th-century. It has a fantastic marble staircase, the original neoclassic-style lift and a multifunctional space on the fifth floor, featuring sloping ceilings and wood beams.

basicData.name: Regina
basicData.title: Regina
basicData.body:
Hotel Regina is an excellent alternative for people wanting to spend a few days in the city centre without worrying about getting around. The hotel is situated at the beginning of calle Alcalá, adjacent to Palacio de Goyeneche, the location of the Real Academia de Bellas Artes de San Fernando fine arts school, where teaching is combined with fine art and painting exhibitions. It is just a short walk away from the major tourist sites, although there is a metro station just in front of the building, and guests can park their cars in the hotel car park.

The hotel provides guests with a car rental service and shuttle bus to Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas airport, as well as organizing tours around the city and day trips to other nearby cities of cultural interest. Built in 1921, the hotel has undergone several renovations over the years. The spacious rooms are equipped with satellite and pay-per-view TV, and Internet connection. There is a function room for all sorts of events, a coffee shop with large windows onto the street and à la carte restaurant which also serves daily set menus. Its specialty dish, the typical Madrid “cocido” stew, can be washed down with any of the excellent wines from the well-stocked cellar.

basicData.name: Príncipe Pío
basicData.title: Príncipe Pío
basicData.body:
Not all hotels can boast of having such a privileged location as this one that stands across from the Sabatini Gardens, opposite the green border surrounding the legendary Debod Temple and Plaza de España and close to Príncipe Pío Station, which is very well connected by metro and the local train service.

The hotel, which opened in 1959 and was refurbished in 2007, makes the most of its location with a terrace from which its guests can enjoy a fantastic view over the area between the Royal Palace, with the dome of La Almudena Cathedral behind it, and the Senate, dotted with trees. These views can also be contemplated from some of its 155 elegantly furnished rooms. The hotel provide guests who would rather use their own cars with discounts in a neighbouring car parking facility. Facilities also include the Ópera bar, a reference to the nearby Teatro Real, and La Pradera de San Isidro restaurant, serving a daily set menu and offering the best traditional Madrid dishes as well as other international fare.

basicData.name: Room Mate Alicia
basicData.title: Room Mate Alicia
basicData.body:
The idea behind the Room Mate hotels was to create a new concept based on a more casual personalized attention. Entrepreneur Enrique Sarasola and three partners decided to refurbish centrically located spaces with an original and fun design always guaranteeing affordable prices.

The first one of them was Room Mate Mario, located near Teatro Real; Alicia followed in 2006, right in Plaza de Santa Ana, in the heart of the Literary Quarter. The industrial building designed in the early 20th century by architect Modesto López Otero is now a modern construction decorated by famous interior designer Pascua Ortega. It features bright rooms with incomparable views onto the terraces in the square. All of them are equipped with LCD flat screens, Wi-Fi Internet connections, satellite TV, DVD and even a mini-swimming-pool in the Duplex room.

This building, before being refurbished and turned into a hotel, was the setting for some of the scenes in the Oscar-winning film by Pedro Almodóvar Talk to Her. The hotel provides a wide range of services, and what many were missing in other hotels: an outstanding breakfast buffet until noon.

basicData.name: Señorial
basicData.title: Señorial
basicData.body:
Hotel Señorial opened its doors in 1960 right in the heart of Madrid. Renovated in 1995, the hotel honours its name with the harmony of its two elegantly furnished buildings, the main one being four storeys high and a six-storey annex.

Its historical background does not prevent this hotel from featuring the latest equipment, ranging from Internet access and satellite TV to a medical and laundry service. Although it does not have a restaurant, it does have a coffee shop serving breakfast buffet and the area includes a wide range of bars and restaurants where guests can satisfy their hunger after a busy day shopping around the city or visiting the old part of town. Some of the sites guests will find just around the hotel are: Plaza de Callao, the Senate, the Sabatini Gardens and the Ferraz Gardens, the Royal Palace, La Almudena Cathedral, Campo del Moro or Palacio de Liria on the other side.

basicData.name: Villamadrid
basicData.title: Villamadrid
basicData.body:
Villamadrid is a modern hotel catering for all kinds of guests. It is located in the northern area of the city, in the new extension of Paseo de la Castellana, between the train stations of Chamartín and Ramón y Cajal, the latter being close to both Ramón y Cajal and La Paz hospitals. Hotel Villamadrid is very well connected to Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas airport, to the Juan Carlos I trade fair complex and to the city centre, by car and by public transport.

The building is equipped with the latest technology in both its rooms, which are equipped with Wi-Fi Internet connection, satellite and pay-per-view TV, and in all its multifunctional rooms suitable for conferences or wedding receptions. The restaurant specialises in market cuisine and has a varied wine list with labels from all the winemaking regions in Spain. The café serves a range of appetizers, liqueurs and informal lunches.

basicData.name: Tryp Menfis
basicData.title: Tryp Menfis
basicData.body:
The hotel occupies a building dating back to 1953 and set in the heart of Gran Vía, the central axis of entertainment in Madrid, packed with restaurants, shops, theatres and cinemas. It is a good choice both for families visiting for tourism and for business travellers. The comfortable and functional environment has everything you would expect to find in a four star hotel, including a fitness centre.

Its excellent location means that guests can take a walk down any of the busy streets in either direction and reach the neighbouring Puerta del Sol, Plaza de Cibeles, Plaza de España and Plaza Mayor. The hotel offers guest a unique opportunity to enjoy their morning coffee or tea overlooking Gran Vía. Guests also have the use of a nearby car park.

basicData.name: Tryp Diana
basicData.title: Tryp Diana
basicData.body: Since 1980, Hotel Tryp Diana has been offering guests the best of their experience in their immense facilities, particularly visitors who are looking for proximity to Barajas Airport, for whom they offer a 24-hour free shuttle service to and from the airport. Thanks to its location, close to both the M-30 and M-40 bypass roads, it is an ideal spot, well connected to other points such as Parque Ferial Juan Carlos I –to which they also offer a shuttle service during trade fair season- and to the national roads. To access the city centre, guests just need to take the subway at the Alameda de Osuna metro stop or any of the many bus lines running in that area. Its large complex features 304 rooms, four conference and banquet rooms, an outdoor pool during the summer months, terrace-garden and a disco-pub. It also includes other services in their shopping area equipped with a hair salon, a travel agency, a clothing and accessory boutique, a massage-chiropractic service, a newspaper stand and a wine specialty shop. The gastronomic offer extends to its multiple bars and restaurants, ranging from the traditional Asador Duque de Osuna, specialized in roasted meats, to El Pato Mudo, specialized in rice dishes, or an Andalusian tavern, a piano bar, a nightclub and a coffee shop, serving a breakfast buffet daily. It’s worthwhile to save some time in the summer for a dip in the pool and a lie-down on the surrounding grass.

basicData.name: Tryp Alcalá 611
basicData.title: Tryp Alcalá 611
basicData.body:
Since 2003, Hotel Tryp Alcalá 611 stands at the end of Calle Alcalá, the longest street in Madrid. Part of the Sol Meliá chain, its excellent location provides easy access to the IFEMA trade fair complex, Barajas Airport and the Municipal Convention Centre. It is also just a few metro stops away from the city centre and well connected to the M-40 bypass, which communicates with all the main roads.

All rooms in the hotel, which is set in a peaceful neighbourhood surrounded by numerous parks, gardens and green areas, get natural light all day, as they overlook either wide Calle Alcalá or the outdoor swimming-pool. Another leisure spot nearby is the huge Olivar de la Hinojosa municipal golf course, covering 2.5 million square metres and located in Campo de las Naciones. Another good option is Faunia wildlife theme park.

The hotel has an agreement with the Telepizza pizza chain for room service and several vending machines for coffee and food. During the summer months, the hotel becomes a very popular because of the outdoor swimming pool, which is great for taking a dip after a stressful work day before relaxing on the lawn.

basicData.name: Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto
basicData.title: Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto
basicData.body:
Part of the prestigious hotel chain Sol Meliá, Hotel Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto offers guests the possibility of enjoying all the luxuries of a hotel of its kind in the peaceful environment of the Barajas residential neighbourhood, near the airport. It is also very close to IFEMA and provides guests with a free shuttle service to and from both the airport and the Juan Carlos I trade fair complex during the fair season.

The hotel is also very well connected with the city centre, which can be accessed via metro line 8 and several bus services, as well as being close to a shopping centre and only fifteen minutes away from Chamartín train station. Hotel Tryp Alameda Aeropuerto is equipped with several conference and function rooms, all featuring natural light, where cocktail, catering, business meal and gala dinner services can be provided. The hotel restaurant has a menu that includes regional cuisine, a buffet and a daily set menu. The hotel also provides guests with free parking outside the building, and free access to the swimming pool across the street.

basicData.name: Suite Prado
basicData.title: Suite Prado
basicData.body:
All the rooms are spacious rooms, averaging 30 to 40 square metres with modern designer furniture. The suites have several different areas: separate living room, bedroom, fully equipped bathroom and kitchenette.

The hotel is right in the heart of Madrid in the Literary Quarter, close to the Art Walk (Prado Museum, Reina Sofía and the Botanical Garden). It is only a few minutes’ walk to Puerta del Sol and El Retiro park.

basicData.name: Preciados
basicData.title: Preciados
basicData.body:
The building occupied nowadays by Hotel Preciados was erected in 1881 on a site owned by the Descalzas Reales nuns, the first owner of which was the count of Romanones. Today, it is a completely renovated modern building located in one of the main shopping areas in the city, on Calle Preciados, on the junction of Sol / Gran Vía.

Since 2002, the hotel has managed to successfully combine the classical elegance of its 19th-century origin with 21st-century avant-garde design. Its incomparable location, right in the heart of Madrid, is flanked by Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol, and just steps away from other interesting sites such as Hapsburg Madrid, Teatro Real, Plaza de Oriente, the Royal Palace or Plaza Mayor.

Culture and shopping come together in this area which is also a prime spot for nightlife, walking distance to popular bars and nightclubs. However, those who would rather enjoy the daytime without relinquishing the advantages of being in the city centre need not worry about their comfort and rest, since all the rooms are soundproof with double glazed windows.

Hotel Preciados also has a restaurant which up until 1959 was the renowned Café Varela, meeting point of numerous great names of literature, including Emilio Carrere, until the mid-20th century. Featuring a modern and minimalist interior design, its menu is based on Mediterranean and Galician cuisine. Their specialties include Coruña-style hake with potatoes and Galician-style octopus, although their tapas, “pinchos” and set menus are served daily. On Sundays, they serve the typical Madrid stew – “cocido madrileño”.

basicData.name: Quinta de los Cedros
basicData.title: Quinta de los Cedros
basicData.body:
The hotel is named after he ancient cedar trees that surround it and stands in a residential neighbourhood in the north of Madrid. It occupies a Renaissance-style mansion similar to a Tuscan villa, it is completely soundproofed from the nearby M-30 bypass, creating an incomparable haven where guests can leave the hustle and bustle of the city behind without relinquishing any of its comforts.

The ten bungalows with terraces and direct access to the garden that make up the hotel occupy the former stables and the main building houses more rooms of varying sizes and decorated in different styles. There is also a conference room, private dining rooms, an English bar and a restaurant.

The terrace of Los Cedros restaurant is unique in Madrid for its views of the garden and the beautiful old cedar trees. The professional service and Mediterranean style menu help create the atmosphere for a memorable lunch or dinner. Guests visiting the city for work can hold meetings in any of the hotel’s function rooms. Between them, the staff team have a wealth of experience which they put to good use to guarantee a successful and satisfactory experience.

basicData.name: Zenit Conde de Orgaz
basicData.title: Zenit Conde de Orgaz
basicData.body:
Hotel Zenit Conde de Orgaz is a perfect choice for business travellers and those visiting the trade fairs held at IFEMA. It is located near the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair precinct and the Palacio Municipal de Congresos, in a business area close to the airport and well connected to the city centre.

The hotel makes good use of the quiet environment where it is located and offers a perfect atmosphere for guests to rest after work or even complete a business deal in one of the several conference rooms that are available. The restaurant, Bouquet, is one of its main attractions, with a menu that includes the most representative dishes of Spanish and international cuisine, always based on fresh seasonal produce.

basicData.name: El Coloso
basicData.title: El Coloso
basicData.body:
El Coloso is an urban hotel, located right in the heart of Madrid, in a small street linking the city’s famous Plaza de España to the refurbished Plaza de Santo Domingo.

From the hotel it is just a short walk to a number of Madrid’s key architectural sites, including Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the Senate and the Teatro Real opera house. The surrounding area features numerous culture and entertainment options, ranging from the Gran Vía-Calle Preciados shopping district to the gastronomic and nightlife attractions in the area’s many bars and clubs. There are also plenty of spaces for rest and relaxation such as the nearby Sabatini and Ferraz Gardens, and Plaza de Oriente, overlooked by the Royal Palace and the neighbouring Almudena Cathedral.

Fully equipped and decorated with special attention to details, both in the common areas and the rooms , El Coloso also solves what might represent the only problem of staying in the city centre: parking. It features a private car park for guests, who can enjoy various other exclusive services. Also designed with business tourism in mind, the hotel includes a social lounge and a business corner, as well as a coffee shop and restaurant which offers a daily breakfast buffet for all guests and à la carte lunch and dinner for groups.

basicData.name: Vincci Soho
basicData.title: Vincci Soho
basicData.body:
Hotel Vincci Soho is housed in five old buildings in the Literary Quarter, all of them considered Historical Heritage. The hotel has maintained the exterior’s charm in this historic area, while transforming the interior into an innovative and avant-garde space. This is very much in line with the new venues in this part of town, which combine past and present in order to create a trendy atmosphere.

It is indeed an ideal hotel for lovers of the latest trends in interior design and decor. The interior is decorated in ochre and red tones, featuring designer furniture and, above all, looking for functionality and comfort. Its restaurant, Hyragana, also reflects this approach. Under chef Jorge Lacera’s guidance, its menu offers innovative and creative cuisine to be enjoyed in a privileged setting: the hotel’s courtyard, a quiet, peaceful spot in the heart of the city.

basicData.name: Zenit Abeba
basicData.title: Zenit Abeba
basicData.body:
Hotel Zenint Abeba exudes luxury and refinement. This is only natural, since it is located in the most exclusive area in the city, close to all the major designer firms and the top boutiques.

Behind a marble façade, the hotel features a classical decoration which pays great attention to detail. Its restaurant, Novus, has become one of its greatest attractions. The key to its success is combining the most popular home-style dishes with the latest culinary trends and the chef’s highly creative signature dishes.

basicData.name: Castilla Plaza
basicData.title: Castilla Plaza
basicData.body:
Since 1993, the Castilla Plaza has stood in the vicinity of the sophisticated Kio Towers, which are the northern gate to the capital and an example of some of the most modern and avant-garde architecture in the city.

Located in one of Madrid’s financial districts, close to the Azca complex and the Palacio de Exposiciones y Congresos convention centre, it is well connected by train, from the nearby Chamartín railway station, and by metro, with the numerous lines that converge at Plaza de Castilla, where there is a bus station at surface level. This privileged location makes the hotel an ideal choice for both business travellers and tourists.

For those who would rather round off the day in their rooms, it also features wonderful scenic views of the mountains near Madrid. But not only guests have access to the hotel’s exclusive facilitiesas it also has a number of rooms where conferences and conventions are held.

basicData.name: AC Coslada Aeropuerto
basicData.title: AC Coslada Aeropuerto
basicData.body: Excellent value for money. The hotel shares the same minimalist style as the rest of the AC chain and is the only hotel in Coslada with a reception room, the perfect place to hold galas, conventions, banquets and other events.

basicData.name: Agumar
basicData.title: Agumar
basicData.body:
When you stay at the Agumar you are only a stone’s throw away from the cultural core of the city. Standing within a few metres of Madrid’s Golden Triangle, formed by the Prado, the Reina Sofía and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, it is also close to the former monastery and current church of San Jerónimo el Real and to the Botanical Gardens.

Although it has its own private car park for those who would rather travel by car, this four-star hotel can be accessed by train or metro, since it is located very close to Atocha station. Hotel Agumar features 245 fully equipped rooms on the eight floors of a 1972 building which has been completely renovated.

After going to the major museums, you can visit many other interesting sites around the hotel, such as the Royal Tapestry Factory or the Basilica of Nuestra Señora de Atocha, and afterwards head to the Retiro Park, to rest in one of Madrid’s largest green areas. On your return, if you’re feeling hungry, the varied menu of the hotel’s restaurant awaits you: specialising in meats, paella and all sorts of rice dishes, it also offers a wide range of starters, cold meats and appetisers. Alternatively, a short walk to the centre of the city allows you to choose from many other gastronomic options..

basicData.name: Diana Plus
basicData.title: Diana Plus
basicData.body:
Hotel Diana Plus is a perfect illustration of the saying that appearances can be deceptive: although its rooms are housed in a large, sober building erected in 1998 in the Centro de Transportes de Madrid (CTM), right on the M-40 ring-road, they are all fully equipped to four-star standards.

Its location, near the MERCAMADRID central food market, provides easy access to all the national roads, which lead directly off the M-40. It is also well connected with the city centre, the Adolfo Suárez-Barajas airport, the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair Park and, if you are looking for adventure, the nearby Warner Bros. theme park. But Diana Plus’s greatest appeal lies in its restaurant and grill, the San Isidro, which specialises in the best traditional Castilian and Basque cuisine. Its signature dish is the wood-fire roasted suckling lamb, washed down with one of the excellent wines from La Rioja or Ribera del Duero. The restaurant offers daily set menus, mixed platters and an extensive list of typical regional tapas. The hotel also extends its services to companies, making available a wide range of menus as well as six rooms for conferences or banquets, equipped with everything necessary to satisfy customers’ needs.

basicData.name: Don Pío
basicData.title: Don Pío
basicData.body:
Hotel Don Pío is a new building located in the northern part of the city, close to Chamartín station, with good connections to Adolfo Suárez-Barajas airport, which is only five kilometres away, and the IFEMA trade fair grounds. The city centre is easily accessed from the metro stop Pío XII, right in front of the building.

The peaceful neighbourhood in which it stands also contains a shopping centre, where guests can purchase anything they need without travelling far. The hotel is decorated in a classical Castilian style, with finely carved wood and hand-woven carpets. The spacious rooms are fully equipped with every possible detail, including bathrooms finished in Greek marble and a Jacuzzi tub.

Its interior features a bright courtyard, where guests can choose either a buffet or continental breakfast every morning. For lunch and dinner, there is an extensive menu of traditional food from Ribera del Duero and a range of other  typical Spanish dishes.

basicData.name: Sercotel Eurobuilding 2
basicData.title: Sercotel Eurobuilding 2
basicData.body:
This apartment-hotel is located in Calle Orense, parallel to Paseo de la Castellana and very close to Plaza de Castilla, in one of the most important business areas in Madrid. It has very good transport connections with Juan Carlos I Trade Fair precinct (IFEMA) and the Palacio de Congresos.

All the apartments consist of a bedroom, a living room and a kitchen. The same services are offered as in a hotel: areas for rest and relaxation, preparation of events, business meetings, presentations, etc.

basicData.name: Celuisma Florida Norte
basicData.title: Celuisma Florida Norte
basicData.body:
The impressive Hotel Celuisma Florida Norte has stood in Paseo de la Florida, outside Príncipe Pío station, since 1973, has rooms decorated in an elegant, classical style.

This four-star hotel is close to the city centre and can be reached on foot, making its location an added attraction. It stands in a quiet neighbourhood, within a triangle formed by three green areas: the Ferraz gardens, containing the Debod Temple, Madrid’s oldest construction, which was brought from Egypt, Campo del Moro, with the Royal Palace and La Almudena Cathedral in the background, and, lastly, Casa de Campo, the largest green area in the city with its popular leisure areas and home to two of Madrid’s main attractions: the Zoo and the Parque de Atracciones amusement park. Tickets for these attractions and other theme parks are available at the hotel, which also organises day-trips to nearby towns of interest to tourists, such as Toledo, El Escorial, Ávila or Segovia.

To make your stay more pleasant and comfortable, the Celuisma Florida Norte offers guests its restaurant, which serves daily set meals and a buffet breakfast.

basicData.name: Hotel Meninas
basicData.title: Meninas
basicData.body:
With a name recalling one of Velázquez’s best known paintings, this centrally located hotel in the Hapsburg district combines tradition and innovation.

The traditional aspect can be seen in the building itself, a 19th-century protected building which has retained its structure and some decorative elements of the time, in tone with the buildings in the surrounding area, which contains the Teatro Real opera house, Plaza de Oriente, the Royal Palace, and the Convent of the Descalzas Reales.

Inside the hotel, however, guests will find a contemporary urban style, with minimalist furniture, chill-out background music and the latest technology. The decor, predominantly fuchsia and green on grey, is reminiscent of an early nineteenth century bourgeois home, but with a very contemporary feel.

basicData.name: VP Jardín de Recoletos
basicData.title: VP Jardín de Recoletos
basicData.body:
VP Jardín de Recoletos, in the Salamanca District, offers spacious and carefully decorated rooms. All suites have their own balconies and hydro massage baths.

Apart from the size of the rooms, the hotel’s other outstanding features are its location, very close to some of the city’s main cultural and tourist attractions, and the peace and quiet. Its greatest asset is the lovely courtyard garden, providing a restful haven in the centre of Madrid.

basicData.name: Gran Versalles
basicData.title: Gran Versalles
basicData.body:
Between the districts of Centro and Chamberí, neighbouring Plaza de Alonso Martínez, stands Hotel Gran Versalles and its eight majestic floors. Built in 1965 and renovated in 1999, it has maintained its original elegance, shown in its spacious and impeccably furnished lobby.

This is a unique hotel for tourists given its closeness to the city centre, which can be accessed by metro, with the closest stop just 20 metres away, or on foot. The latter will constitute a pleasant walk through streets in emblematic neighbourhoods such as Chueca, providing plenty of entertainment with its many shops and other establishments.

As well as the services you would expect to find in a four-star hotel, Gran Versalles offers an additional series of services exclusively for business travellers, who have the option of using any of the hotel conference rooms, or the interpreting, secretary and hostess services, as well as the shuttle to Barajas airport or day trips. However, the hotel also takes good care of guests’ palates, with a restaurant specialising in traditional cuisine and featuring a buffet with a wide variety of dishes, even for those following special diets.

On the other hand, Café Luxemburgo, which also provides the room catering service, serving with drinks ranging from coffee to cocktails, plus assorted appetizers and varied tapas.

basicData.name: Gran Atlanta
basicData.title: Gran Atlanta
basicData.body:
Hotel Gran Atlanta stands right in Madrid’s financial and business district, in the heart of the Azca complex. The building, erected in 1973 and featuring a marble façade, has been completely refurbished.

Its location guarantees guests a peaceful stay, since the hotel is in one of the stateliest neighbourhoods in the capital, adjoining the traditional district of Chamberí. It is also very close to the Nuevos Ministerios station (which provides a direct metro link to Adolfo Suárez-Barajas Airport), the legendary Santiago Bernabéu stadium, home of Real Madrid, Torre Picasso, and the Palacio de Exposiciones y Congresos convention centre, whose façade is decorated with an enormous mural by Joan Miró. The building is surrounded by numerous bars and restaurants, many of which specialise in Basque cuisine, while the area’s streets contain several large shopping centres.

In any of the conference rooms the hotel can arrange a coffee break service, business meals, and audiovisual screening. The restaurant offers a delicious breakfast buffet every morning.

basicData.name: Vincci Vía 66
basicData.title: Vincci Vía 66
basicData.body:
Hotel Vincci Gran Vía 66 has used a classical building featuring the typical architecture of the old part of town and transformed its interior into an innovatively designed space, provided with every comfort and facility of a modern four-star hotel.

Its most appealing feature is its location, right in the heart of Gran Vía, known as Madrid’s Broadway because of  its theatres. Once inside the hotel, guests can disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city with a visit to the hotel’s spa.

basicData.name: Rafael Hoteles Orense
basicData.title: Rafael Hoteles Orense
basicData.body:
Rafael Hoteles Orense is a four-star hotel which fits perfectly into the area where it is located, the Azca complex. It is a modern building, in line with the financial district, and blends in well with the Palacio de Congresos convention centre and the Santiago Bernabéu stadium, which are nearby.

This is an ideal hotel both for visitors coming to Madrid on business and for tourists, since its privileged location is well connected with the financial district and with the main tourist sites. And all its guests can enjoy the wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues in the Azca complex.

basicData.name: Senator Gran Vía 70 Spa
basicData.title: Senator Gran Vía 70 Spa
basicData.body:
Relaxing in a bubble bath on a rooftop 100 metres above street level right in the heart of Madrid is a treat which guests can enjoy at Hotel Senator Gran Vía 70 Spa during the summer months. During the rest of the year, its urban spa, Acquaplaya, offers a long list of relaxing proposals such as the heated pool with jets of water at different levels, an Indo-Roman bath, a fruit pool, Turkish baths, a frosted ice and water spray grotto, a rounded stone pool, bubble hydro-massage, a relaxation room, Finnish saunas and an immersion bath.

To achieve absolute relaxation, guests can also take advantage of the hotel’s treatment area, featuring Scottish showers, tanning beds, facial and body beauty treatments, spa therapy, mud therapy, and invigorating or relaxing moist and dry massages. Although the hotel is located in Plaza de España, with tourist sites, shops and entertainment close at hand, guests will not need to leave the building in order to spend a few days relaxing. A series of special programmes is available for stress-reduction, body firming, and anti-cellulite treatments, which last from one to five days and are guaranteed to bring a feeling of peace and relaxation, however stressed you may be.

basicData.name: Senator Gran Vía 21
basicData.title: Senator Gran Vía 21
basicData.body:
Senator Gran Vía is housed in one of those stunning early twentieth-century buildings which contribute to the city centre’s grandeur. It is located in the street after which it is named and is thus ideal for visitors who wish to explore the real Madrid, to live the city from its core and to enjoy all the culture and entertainment Madrid has to offer.

In line with the building it occupies, its interior decoration is elegant, with simple contemporary furniture. One of the most appealing features of this four-star hotel is its interior courtyard, which is covered and air-conditioned so that guests can enjoy it throughout the year, having coffee or a drink in a quiet atmosphere while still in the heart of the city.

basicData.name: Siete Islas
basicData.title: Siete Islas
basicData.body:
The Fortunate Isles are the theme of Hotel Siete Islas, which takes its name from them. Each of the rooms represents one of the villages in the archipelago, and their decor is inspired by the culture of the Canary Islands, present in every corner of the hotel.

This four-star hotel is located right in the heart of the city, in Calle Valverde in the Literary Quarter. Thanks to its proximity to Gran Vía, it is an ideal choice for visitors who wish to explore the culture and entertainment that Madrid has to offer, as well as getting to know the city’s true spirit.

basicData.name: Exe Puerta Castilla
basicData.title: Exe Puerta Castilla
basicData.body:
The Exe Puerta Castilla is a modern hotel, conveniently located in Paseo de la Castellana, and featuring everything necessary to close a business deal.

Its architecture blends in perfectly with the ensemble of surrounding buildings, including the Kio Towers, known as Puerta de Europa. The hotel’s rooms were designed with the business traveller in mind, although they are also ideal for tourists, since the hotel is surrounded by restaurants, shops and entertainment venues, in addition to being well connected to the historical centre. All guests can enjoy making use of the gym, sauna and Jacuzzi, while the hotel’s restaurant is one of the finest in the northern part of the city, with a menu based on the chef’s signature regional dishes

basicData.name: Quatro Puerta del Sol
basicData.title: Quatro Puerta del Sol
basicData.body:
With Puerta del Sol on one side and the Golden Triangle of Art on the other, the Literary Quarter in front of it and Gran Vía behind it, Hotel Quatro Puerta del Sol is surrounded by the best Madrid has to offer in entertainment, culture, shopping and art.

The distinctive character of this hotel, which opened in 2003, stems from the combination of an elegant early twentieth-century building in an area with a rich history and the work of the most popular interior designer in Madrid, Tomás Alía, who has turned this hotel into a modern, functional building, where spaciousness and light are the keynotes, and great attention is paid to details. The rooms, primarily black and white, also reflect the elegant, sophisticated atmosphere of the hotel.

basicData.name: Rafael Hoteles Atocha
basicData.title: Rafael Hoteles Atocha
basicData.body:
The Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofía museums, the Planetarium and the Retiro Park are just a few of the sites close to this hotel, named after Atocha station, which is also nearby.

Rafael Hoteles Atocha is an ideal hotel for every traveller. Those who come on a business trip will find, apart from the usual services of a four-star hotel, a meetings hall which can hold up to 900 people. To those travelling for pleasure, it offers a prime location to explore the most interesting sites in the city. And for visitors of all types it features a gym, a garden, where one can leave behind the stress of the city, a restaurant, where guests can enjoy the best of Mediterranean cuisine, and a piano bar, where one can relax and have a drink while listening to music in an elegant atmosphere.

basicData.name: Praga
basicData.title: Praga
basicData.body:
Hotel Praga is a four-star hotel located in the southwestern part of Madrid, on the banks of the Manzanares river, close to the M-30 by-pass and the Vicente Calderón stadium. Atocha station and the Art Walk are within easy reach.

Its decor is simple yet modern, and the use of marble is predominant throughout the building. The hotel’s restaurant, El Puente de Praga, offers a menu featuring international cuisine. There is also a bar-coffee shop for those preferring a more casual atmosphere.

basicData.name: Petit Palace San Bernardo
basicData.title: Petit Palace San Bernardo
basicData.body:
Petit Palace San Bernardo offers a peaceful space right in the heart of Madrid and is an ideal option for those visitors who are in town for work and for families who are spending a few days in the capital.

The hotel features rooms tailored to the needs of specific types of guest, but they all are decorated in a contemporary style and equipped with the latest technology. These features of the hotel’s innovative interior contrast with its traditional external appearance, as it is housed in an early twentieth-century building, whose façade is very much in line with the others in the city centre.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Posada del Peine
basicData.title: Petit Palace Posada del Peine
basicData.body:
Probably one of the oldest hotels in Spain and the oldest in Madrid. It was founded at the beginning of the 17th century to accommodate guests and visitors to the Court, taking advantage of its location next to the main stagecoach stop. In the 19th century, it expanded into the adjoining building overlooking Calle de Postas, resulting in its current address and considerable size.

The location of the room guests were assigned depended on how wealthy they were. So,  rooms that overlooked the street were more expensive but more spacious, comfortable and well-ventilated than those facing inwards. After a number of refurbishments, it was taken over by the High Tech chain, which reopened it at the end of summer 2005, under the name Hotel Petit Palace Posada del Peine.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Plaza del Carmen
basicData.title: Petit Palace Plaza del Carmen
basicData.body:
Petit Palace Plaza del Carmen has turned a former school into a boutique hotel, ideal for visitors who wish to stay in the heart of Madrid. Located in the square after which it is named, it is very close to Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol and is surrounded by places of interest to tourists and cultural and entertainment attractions.

This four-star hotel opened its doors in 2006. It has retained several elements from the former school, such as the large windows, the wooden beams in the top floor’s slanted ceilings, the entrance hall’s stone floor, and the exposed brickwork in the basement, which is now a dining area  with the look of a wine cellar. The innovative touches come from its modern decor and avant-garde design, as well as the cutting-edge technology installed on the premises.

basicData.name: Silken Puerta Madrid
basicData.title: Silken Puerta Madrid
basicData.body:
Inaugurated in 2002, this modern building featuring avant-garde architecture is conveniently located close to the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair complex and Adolfo Suárez-Barajas Airport. Hotel Silken Puerta Madrid was designed with a specific guest in mind: the business traveller.

As well as the usual services offered by four-star hotels it boasts an executive floor and a business centre for this type of visitor. To round off the working day, guests can enjoy a meal at the Restaurante-Parrilla-Horno de Asar La Orza, which offers a seasonal menu accompanied by a wide selection of wines. Visitors will also find that the bar provides a relaxing atmosphere, where they can have a drink while enjoying some good music.

basicData.name: Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria
basicData.title: Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria
basicData.body:
Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria is a business hotel that provides more than just comfort and work facilities for its guests, placing special emphasis on gastronomy. 'El Patio’ serves traditional Spanish specialties and delicious tapas in a cosy atmosphere, while 'Mare Nostrum' is another possibility, featuring international and Mediterranean cuisine.

This four-star hotel is located close to the Municipal Convention Centre and the Juan Carlos I trade fair grounds. An attractive option in summer is to have a dip in the outdoor pool and then sunbathe on one of the Balinese sun loungers on the sundeck.

basicData.name: Mercure Madrid Plaza de España
basicData.title: Mercure Madrid Plaza de España
basicData.body:
Mercure Madrid Plaza de España is conveniently located in the centre of Madrid, making it a perfect choice for visitors who wish to explore the city and get to know its true spirit, as well as for those who want to take advantage of a business trip to enjoy Madrid.

This four-star hotel’s elegant and refined atmosphere is achieved through a combination of modern design, French art de vivre and Spanish cuisine and entertainment. The rooms have a touch of classical luxury and are equipped with the latest technology.

basicData.name: Vincci Centrum Madrid
basicData.title: Vincci Centrum Madrid
basicData.body:
Hotel Vincci Centrum offers an attractive cocontrast to the classical style found in the city centre. Inaugurated in 2004, this four-star hotel is housed in a modern building which is elegantly designer-furnished.

Located between Puerta del Sol and the Golden Triangle of the Arts, it is in a perfect spot for visitors who wish to explore the city, standing in the heart of the area where the city’s most important art and monuments are to be found, with a full range of entertainment options close at hand.

basicData.name: Vincci Capitol
basicData.title: Vincci Capitol
basicData.body:
Hotel Vincci Capitol is located above the iconic Capitol cinema, in a building typical of Madrid’s Art Deco style. Its exterior and structure have been maintained, but the interior has been transformed into a modern four-star hotel.

It is an ideal choice for visitors looking for a hotel overlooking Madrid’s most urban area: Gran Vía. A never-ending series of entertainment options can be found right outside its doors in Gran Vía, often referred to as Madrid’s Broadway, as well as being a major shopping area. The main tourist and cultural attractions are only a stone’s throw away. And if you just want to lie back and relax, try the building’s rooftop solarium.

basicData.name: Velada Madrid
basicData.title: Velada Madrid
basicData.body: Velada Madrid is a four-star hotel which was inaugurated in 2003 in a modern and versatile building built specifically to house this hotel. It is conveniently located on calle Alcalá, which is one of the citys main arteries, hence connected both to the historical centre and to the financial district. In terms of gastronomy, they feature restaurant El Tostado and their coffee shop, El Pórtico. The also offer other facilities, such as indoor pool, sauna, gym, tanning beds, massage service and everything guests might need in order to leave the hotel happy and relaxed, even if theirs was a business trip.

basicData.name: TRYP Madrid Cibeles
basicData.title: TRYP Madrid Cibeles
basicData.body:
Tryp Cibeles has every side of Madrid at its feet: traditional, cosmopolitan, artistic, and monumental. Thanks to its location, it is an ideal choice for every type of traveller.

The eight-storey hotel is located above a world-famous Spanish fashion firm, in one of the most beautiful modernist buildings in the busy Gran Vía. This historical building perfectly suits the atmosphere of this twenty-first century four-star hotel.

basicData.name: TRYP Madrid Atocha
basicData.title: TRYP Madrid Atocha
basicData.body:
Tryp Atocha is a new hotel, inaugurated in 2002, but housed in a palatial early twentieth-century building, located in the Literary Quarter near the Art Walk and close to Atocha station.

Surrounded by the major museums, the historic and monumental centre and the main shopping areas, this four-star hotel is a perfect choice for travellers visiting the capital for tourism. However, being near the financial and business district, it is also a good choice for business travellers who want to make the best of their stay in Madrid. And if they need to discuss a deal during their stay, the hotel has several conference rooms for this purpose.

basicData.name: TRYP Madrid Ambassador
basicData.title: TRYP Madrid Ambassador
basicData.body:
Hotel Tryp Ambassador is housed in a nineteenth-century building located in the historic centre of the capital. The original structure of the building, which was formerly the palace of the Dukes of Granada de Ega, has been maintained, as well as its classical stately style, in line with the nearby Royal Palace and Teatro Real opera house.

This four-star hotel is thus ideal for visitors who wish to explore the classical features of Madrid, but with all the other attractions  the city has to offer just a few steps away. Stroll down the streets towards Plaza Mayor to get a taste of the most authentic side of Madrid, walk through Puerta del Sol to enjoy the artistic vein of the city, or go to Gran Vía to get to know the cosmopolitan face of the capital.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Art Gallery
basicData.title: Petit Palace Art Gallery
basicData.body:
A very special cow welcomes guests to Petit Palace Art Gallery, which is more like an art gallery offering accommodation than a traditional hotel. This is one of the many reasons why this four-star hotel is ideal for art lovers, but not the only one, since it is located close to the three major museums: the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofía. It is also near other interesting museums, such as the Archaeological Museum, the Natural Science Museum and the Wax Museum, and is surrounded by art galleries and art shops.

Another of its appealing features is the combination of tradition and innovation, which is almost a given in the exclusive, elegant Salamanca neighbourhood, where it stands. The hotel is housed in a nineteenth-century building which has retained the architectural features typical of the time. However, the hotel has been provided with the latest technology and furnished in an avant-garde style. Its restaurant, formerly a coal cellar, is very much in line with the rest of the hotel, featuring a minimalist style with quotations by famous figures as decorative elements.

basicData.name: Palacio de San Martín
basicData.title: Palacio de San Martín
basicData.body:
Hotel Palacio San Martín is a four-star hotel right in the heart of Madrid, opposite the Convent of the Descalzas Reales and a few metres away from Gran Vía, Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Oriente, making it a perfect choice for travellers wishing to stay in the very centre of the city.

The building has an aristocratic air and its interior features marble, fine wood and high ceilings. One of this hotel’s many advantages is the view of the city guests can enjoy while having a meal in the restaurant on the sixth floor. Breakfast is served in the building’s panoramic penthouse.

basicData.name: Nuevo Madrid
basicData.title: Nuevo Madrid
basicData.body:
Inaugurated in 2005, Hotel Nuevo Madrid is a modern hotel geared to a specific type of guest: demanding executives who are in Madrid on business and will appreciate a touch of original design.

The hotel is located to the north of the capital, in the new business area between Arturo Soria and the M-30 north by-pass. The building is predominantly glass, featuring a glass façade, and it is decorated in light tones, with sophisticated yet functional furniture. It has a convention centre providing a multipurpose space for events such as conferences, conventions, business meetings, training courses, presentations or banquets. After work guests can relax at the hotel’s gym, Jacuzzi and sauna. The hotel’s restaurant offers Mediterranean and international cuisine, while guests can enjoy a more casual atmosphere in the bar.

basicData.name: Novotel Madrid Sanchinarro
basicData.title: Novotel Madrid Sanchinarro
basicData.body:
Novotel Madrid Sanchinarro was built recently in one of the new residential areas in Madrid, after which it is named. It is located in the northern access to the city, just a few minutes away from the airport and the Juan Carlos I trade fair grounds (IFEMA).

It is a perfect hotel for business travellers who wish to keep away from the hustle and bustle of the city and are looking for a peaceful place where they can relax at the end of the workday. Here they can enjoy their time in the garden, at the restaurant, on the golf course or, during the summer months, at the outdoor pool, a true peaceful oasis in the middle of a buzzing city.

basicData.name: NH Parque Avenidas
basicData.title: NH Parque Avenidas
basicData.body:
NH Parque Avenidas Hotel features something that not many others can offer in the city centre, especially this close to the historical part of town. During the summer, the hotel offers appealing facilities: a swimming pool with a solarium in the middle of a charming garden, making the hotel especially attractive to families with children who wish to have a real vacation as well as exploring the city.

Located in the Salamanca district, very close to the Las Ventas Bullring, NH Parque de las Avenidas is decorated primarily in wood and marble. This hotel is also a good option for meetings and all sorts of celebrations. When the weather is nice, the hotel makes use of a marquise in the garden to complement the indoor rooms.

basicData.name: Novotel Madrid Campo de las Naciones
basicData.title: Novotel Madrid Campo de las Naciones
basicData.body:
Novotel Madrid Campo de las Naciones is the perfect choice for visitors who are in town to attend a convention or one of the many trade fairs that are held at the IFEMA trade fair grounds every year, since it is located across from the Municipal Convention Centre, just steps away from the Juan Carlos I trade fair grounds, and very close to the airport.

This modern four-star hotel, decorated in a very contemporary style, includes conference rooms for guests who need to work during their stay, but also other features related to leisure, such as an outdoor pool and a solarium. For those who enjoy going for walks, the Juan Carlos I Park is just metres away. In summer, there’s no better plan than to rest and sunbathe on one of the sun beds next to the outdoor swimming pool and return home with a nice tan.

basicData.name: NH Príncipe de Vergara
basicData.title: NH Principe de Vergara
basicData.body:
The Salamanca district is the epitome of shopping and luxury, which makes Hotel NH Príncipe de Vergara a perfect choice for those who are in town to shop at the most exclusive boutiques.  Less than 5 minutes from the hotel is one of the most exclusive shopping areas in Madrid, located in the streets Serrano, Vázquez and Goya, with shops from the best brands in the world.

This four-star hotel includes a restaurant for breakfasts, an a-la-carte restaurant, bars, various halls for events, car park and gym. It also offers laundry, cloakroom, room service and alarm service.

basicData.name: NH Sanvy
basicData.title: NH Sanvy
basicData.body:
NH Sanvy is a four-star hotel and an ideal choice both for families with children and for business travellers. The former will appreciate the entertainment offer in the area, and also the outdoor pool. The latter will find it convenient thanks to its location, near Plaza de Colón, thanks to its conference rooms and its team of professionals who are available for any sort of event-planning.

It also avails of an excellent gastronomy offering, although in the summer the largest attraction of the hotel was the swimming pool. It is a privilege to be able to relax after a day of tourism in an outdoor pool that also has a solarium terrace for sunbathing and relaxation.

basicData.name: Novotel Madrid Puente de La Paz
basicData.title: Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz
basicData.body:
Located in one of the largest residential and business areas in the city, just minutes away from Barajas Airport and Trade Fair Area Juan Carlos I, Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz is a perfect hotel for business travellers. With them in mind, as well as being in an ideal location in order to get to the main financial areas, the hotel also features a business centre which includes several conference rooms.

On the other hand, it is also a good option for families visiting the city, since it is removed from the hustle and bustle of the city, yet well connected, and it has an outdoor pool which they can enjoy during the summer months.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Alcalá Torre
basicData.title: Petit Palace Alcalá Torre
basicData.body:
Housed in a distinctive early 20th-century building, Petit Palace Alcalá Torre is also unique for the magnificent views afforded by the fifty-metre high property.

Furthermore, thanks to its privileged location on Calle Alcalá, close to the main business area and the historical and monumental centre, this four-star hotel is an ideal choice for visitors to the capital. The rooms, apart from offering a stunning panoramic view of the city centre, are equipped with the latest technology and decorated in a modern, functional style. The hotel’s restaurant, El Bilbaíno, also features a birds-eye view from the fifth floor.

basicData.name: TH Mercader
basicData.title: H2 Mercader
basicData.body:
Hotel H2 Mercader, very appropriately named, is a hotel for merchants and business people coming to the largest food market in Spain, Mercamadrid. For these guests, this four-star hotel offers all the features of a hotel in its class, as well as everything necessary for them to close business from the hotel itself.

With a modern architectural design and a contemporary and functional interior, it also offers other possibilities geared towards leisure and relax, such as the restaurant with healthy home-made food and the free parking.

basicData.name: NH Nacional
basicData.title: NH Nacional
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Nacional is an ideal choice if you are looking to explore the artistic and monumental side of Madrid. It is located near all three major museums, Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofía, as well as the Royal Botanical Gardens, opposite the hotel. Just a few steps away, the Literary Quarter, Hapsburg Madrid or Gran Vía, the most modern area in the city.

Combining both classical and modern styles, this four-star hotel is equipped with several conference rooms, available for those business travellers who are staying at the NH Nacional for its closeness to the business and financial district, on Paseo de la Castellana.

basicData.name: NH La Habana
basicData.title: NH La Habana
basicData.body:
Hotel NH La Habana is an ideal choice for soccer fans who are in town to attend a game at Santiago Bernabéu stadium, as well as for business travellers and families who are visiting the capital. Location is everything, since it stands near Real Madrid's stadium, in the heart of the business and financial district and close to the capital's convention centre. As well as that, this area has a never-ending entertainment offer and is just minutes away from the major tourist sites.

The hotel tries to offer personal attention to every type of guest, thus, business travellers have several conference rooms available to hold any sort of events, as well as a series of additional services to ease their job.

basicData.name: NH Collection Madrid Eurobuilding
basicData.title: NH Eurobuilding
basicData.body:
Just 200 metres from the Paseo de la Castellana we find this elegant and functional four-star hotel, which has been fully renovated in 2014 and offers outstanding gastronomy and relaxation. Situated in the heart of the financial district, it is a 15-storey building with 412 spacious rooms, including Superior rooms that are 30 square metres, and Premium rooms, which come with a large terrace area offering views over the city. It also has 32 spaces for meetings and conventions, between 10 and 1,000 square metres, with a capacity for up to 1,300 people.

One of the major draws of the NH Collection Madrid Eurobuilding is its incredible gastronomic offer, led by DiverXO, the restaurant with three Michelin stars headed up by chef David Muñoz. It also offers an outstanding restaurant serving international cuisine and Spanish tapas, overseen by Paco Roncero - a chef with two Michelin stars - as well as Japanese haute cuisine at 99 Sushi Bar, and cocktails served up by leading Argentine barman Diego Cabrera.

Another of the main services offered by the NH Eurobuilding is the Metropolitan Spa-Balneario, a facility covering 500 square metres with a modern health and beauty centre based on the curative effects of water, with a swimming pool with floating paths and Turkish bath, as well as paddle courts and a solarium terrace with beach.

basicData.name: Meliá Galgos
basicData.title: Meliá Galgos
basicData.body:
The Meliá Galgos is the perfect option for business and leisure, thanks to its excellent location in the city centre, its complete and comfortable facilities and the quality of tis service. It is very close to the best shopping centres, boutiques and fashion areas of Madrid.

Among its facilities are a complete equipped gym for guests, a sauna, conference rooms fully equipped with the latest technology, as well as a public carpark and a roof-top solarium from which visitors can admire a different perspective of the city.

basicData.name: NH Abascal
basicData.title: NH Abascal
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Abascal offers an exclusive combination that provides a four-star service to suit all sorts of guests. Its three major perks are location, in the Chamberí area and near to Paseo de la Castellana; a historical building, a former embassy, stately and built in neoclassical style, and thirdly, a carefully selected interior design, featuring an elegant and original touch and the latest in comfort.

The other star feature is its restaurant, which offers excellent cooking with regional influences and modern touches. Furthermore, the hotel has a terrace where guests can enjoy a cocktail or a glass of wine in a very sophisticated atmosphere.

basicData.name: NH Puerta de Alcalá
basicData.title: NH Alcalá
basicData.body:
Hotel NH Alcalá is located within the Salamanca district, which is one of the most exclusive areas for shopping and business in the capital city. It is an ideal starting point for discovering the city, walking through the Retiro to the museums (the Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofía) or crossing the Castellana towards Gran Vía, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.

If offers completely sound-proof rooms that are comfortable and have wooden floors. In terms of gastronomy, the hotel suggests the restaurant of NH Alcalá, which offers delicious dishes for all tastes in an environment with elegant décor.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Embassy
basicData.title: Petit Palace Embassy
basicData.body:
A nineteenth-century building in exclusive Calle Serrano houses this four-star hotel, ideal for visitors shopping for designer brands and for executives searching for a luxury environment for their stay in the city.

For the former, this hotel is a great choice since it is surrounded by shops selling goods made by major designer firms. For the latter, the Salamanca neighbourhood, where it stands, is conveniently located in the centre of the city’s financial district. Petit Palace Embassy has retained the building’s brick walls and wooden staircases, combining these with contemporary elements, creating a minimalist atmosphere and including the latest technology. The result is a modern, functional decor, with all the comforts of a twenty-first century four-star hotel.

basicData.name: Hotel Serrano
basicData.title: Hotel Serrano
basicData.body:
Hotel Serrano Royal offers a peaceful and quiet environment that ensures their guests rest. This four-star hotel, located in the Salamanca neighbourhood, fits right in with its surroundings, featuring a classical decor and much attention to detail.

The area, the most exclusive and elegant in Madrid, provides the ideal atmosphere for fashion-lovers looking to shop, as all the major designer boutiques are present in what is known as the Golden Mile, as well as the trendiest restaurants and the classiest venues.

basicData.name: Emperador
basicData.title: Emperador
basicData.body:
Hotel Emperador is a four-star hotel located in the heart of Gran Vía, surrounded by theatres, cinemas, shops, restaurants, discos and the major tourist sites in the capital.

Thus, it is an ideal option for visitors who wish to explore the city and enjoy its culture and entertainment offer. Likewise, it is a great choice for business travellers, since the hotel features several conference rooms, aside from Club Emperador, a luxury environment for business. One of the most appealing features in this classical hotel is its outdoor pool, open during the summer months and from which guests can enjoy a privileged view of the city while taking a dip in this roof-top swimming-pool. A sauna and gym are also available.

basicData.name: Confortel Suites Madrid
basicData.title: Confortel Suites Madrid
basicData.body:
Confortel Suites Madrid is an ideal hotel for both business travellers and fashion-lovers who wish to shop, since it is conveniently located on calle López de Hoyos, well connected with the airport, the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos (trade fair grounds) and Madrid's business centre.

Visitors here for business have access to the Business Class services as well as several conference rooms for business meetings. And those looking to shop can enjoy the fashionable atmosphere of the Salamanca neighbourhood, where they will find the most exclusive boutiques. All of the rooms in this four-star hotel are suites, equipped with cutting-edge technology to suit the business traveller's needs, and decorated in a classical and comfortable style.

basicData.name: Emperatriz
basicData.title: Emperatriz
basicData.body:
Hesperia Emperatriz is a stately hotel located in a quiet area in the Salamanca neighbourhood, one of the most elegant and exclusive in the city, close to the financial district and home to the great designers boutiques.

This is the ideal choice for guests who wish to enjoy a peaceful stay without giving up their proximity to the city centre. Built in a classical building, the interior design in this four-star hotel is by Casa&Jardín. It combines antique and modern pieces, creating a very cosy atmosphere in line with the building and the neighbourhood in which it is located. Its restaurant, Atrium, offers the best of Spanish and international cuisine, and a carefully selected wine list.

basicData.name: Holiday Inn Madrid - Bernabéu
basicData.title: Holiday Inn Madrid - Bernabéu
basicData.body:
Holiday Inn Madrid - Bernabéu is a modern and functional hotel, suitable both for business travellers and for those who wish to explore the culture, entertainment or shopping options in Madrid, as it is conveniently located in the Azca complex. This area is well known for being the financial and business district, close to the Palacio de Congresos (Convention centre) and Santiago Bernabéu stadium, and includes a wide variety of shops and restaurants.

For that reason, the hotel features all sorts of different rooms, to provide for all sorts of guests. It has regular rooms and executive rooms, and classic suites as well as family suites, each one oriented towards a different type of guest In terms of gastronomy, the hotel offers a wide range: market produce and Mediterranean and international cuisine.

In the summer one of the main advantages of this hotel is its pool, along with a gym equipped with sauna. The pool is in a solarium where guests can sunbathe. .

basicData.name: Hotel Chamartín
basicData.title: Hotel Chamartín
basicData.body:
Hotel Chamartín is said to be one of the hotels with the best connections in the city, since it is located next to the train station after which it is named and is also close to the airport. Thus, it is ideal for business travellers who have little time to devote to travelling within the city. Furthermore, it is the business and financial district, where many of the major companies are located.

For this type of traveller, the hotel features a business centre with several spaces and conference rooms as well as a team of professionals readily available to organize all sorts of events. And to make the best of their free time and relax after a long workday, guests can choose from their restaurant to a nearby gym with a spa, which is also available to guests.

basicData.name: Hotel Paseo del Arte
basicData.title: Hotel Paseo del Arte
basicData.body:
The Prado, the Thyssen and the Reina Sofía museums are Hotel Husa Paseo del Arte’s neighbours. Inaugurated in 2006, this modern four-star hotel is highly recommended for visitors who wish to enjoy Madrid’s art and culture.

The hotel’s decoration pays great attention to detail and its atmosphere is predominantly functional, with suggestive lines and natural light as a key element. The hotel suggests a visit to the gym or the solarium for a good nights sleep after working out and releasing adrenalin or relaxing lying out in the sun.

basicData.name: VP Jardín Metropolitano
basicData.title: VP Jardín Metropolitano
basicData.body:
Inaugurated in 2005, the Jardín Metropolitano is an modern hotel located in a modern building on Avenida Reina Victoria, a peaceful area by Glorieta de Cuatro Caminos and close to Paseo de la Castellana.

This four-star hotel is geared towards both business travellers and tourists. It features conference rooms adding up to a total of 400 square meters devoted to all sorts of events. These are complemented with the indoor gardens, one of them Asian-inspired, which brighten up the hotel. At Hotel Jardín Metropolitano, gastronomy is one of the basic pillars. Its restaurant, Cartago, originated from the idea of bringing an haute cuisine reference to the area. Its menu offers authors cuisine, but with a solid base of traditional cuisine.

basicData.name: Mercure Madrid Centro (Lope de Vega)
basicData.title: Lope de Vega
basicData.body:
Lope de Vega is a thematic hotel dedicated to Lope de Vega and the Spanish Golden Age. In line with the hotels spirit, it is located in the Literary Quarter, which is the citys core when it comes to the arts and monuments. This charming area, in the heart of the capital, also features major entertainment and culture venues.

 In this hotel, the decor in each floor is based on a different aspect of the historical and cultural context of the great playwright Lope de Vega. The rooms also follow this trend, and each one of them is inspired by a character, a title, a place in 17th-century Madrid, a king or the women who marked the writers love life. Furthermore, the hotel features a library inspired in the 17th century.

basicData.name: De Las Letras
basicData.title: Iberostar Las Letras Gran Vía
basicData.body:
Hotel Iberostar Las Letras Gran Vía is one of the newest hotel offerings, perfectly combining tradition and innovation. The former comes with the building itself, built in the early 20th century and declared part of the Community Heritage. Particularly noteworthy are its mosaics, its marquises, staircases or original sculptures, along with the literary quotes decorating the walls. Its innovative side comes from its location, in the most cosmopolitan neighbourhood, the interior design by Virginia Figueras, the new technologies it features, the spa, the restaurant and the hotel’s terrace.

This four-star hotel is ideal for visitors who keep up with the latest trends and who wish to experience life in the heart of the city, and everything that comes with staying on Gran Vía: bars, discos, shops, theatres, movie theatres, museums, tourist sites,... It is not in vain that this hotel offers a series of services in order to relax after a hectic day about town, such as its complete spa, its library or the cutting-edge TV sets and wifi equipment in the rooms. The restaurant and the terrace require their own exclusive mention. DLs Restaurant is one of the hotels major initiatives, offering a seasonal authors cuisine. The terrace, Air Lounge, is a real treat for summer nights, a place where customers can enjoy an informal dinner or a drink with Madrid at their feet.

basicData.name: Liabeny
basicData.title: Liabeny
basicData.body:
Hotel Liabeny is a stately hotel particularly recommended for visitors who wish to explore the heart of the city and enjoy its cinemas, theatres, monuments, museums, restaurants..., since it is located between Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol, where guests will find endless possibilities to make the best out of their free time.

However, it is also a good option for executives and business travellers, given that the hotel features a business centre and several conference rooms. In order to enjoy their free time at the hotel, Hotel Liabeny offers its guests a complete gym and a Finnish sauna. Another convenient aspect is the parking garage that guests can make use of, which is a clear advantage in the city centre.

basicData.name: Lusso Infantas
basicData.title: Lusso Infantas
basicData.body:
Housed in a 19th-century building, Hotel Lusso Infantas combines innovation and tradition. It is located in the heart of the Chueca neighbourhood, one of the most dynamic areas in the city when it comes to entertainment, gastronomy or shopping. It is just a few steps away from Paseo de la Castellana, Paseo del Prado, Paseo de Recoletos and calle Alcalá, thus making this hotel an ideal spot for both business travellers and those looking to explore the entertainment and culture agenda in the capital.

One of the main attractions of this hotel is its restaurant, Ex Libris, offering a traditional cuisine with innovative touches and a carefully selected wine list. Furthermore, it features a large collection of ex libris, artistic prints on one of the front pages of a book, used by some people or institutions to denote ownership.

basicData.name: María Elena Palace
basicData.title: María Elena Palace
basicData.body:
Hotel María Elena Palace is a perfect choice for both business travellers and tourists, since it is conveniently located in the city centre. Just a few metres away from Puerta del Sol, it is surrounded by major culture and entertainment venues, and is also very close to the financial district.

Its interior features an exclusive yet functional atmosphere. It is located in a modern building with a particularly noteworthy glass dome in its luxurious stately area, and courtyards enclosed with domes made of marble, natural stone, wood and carved glass.

basicData.name: Best Western Hotel Mayorazgo
basicData.title: Best Western Hotel Mayorazgo
basicData.body:
Hotel Mayorazgo is one of those old-style hotels, with a traditional decor and a taste for classicism, present since its early days. It is located in the heart of Madrid, in the most authentic and traditional area in the city, close to Gran Vía and Puerta del Sol. It is surrounded by major tourist sites as well as culture and entertainment venues, and well connected to the financial and business district.

In terms of gastronomy, their restaurant, the Piano Bar, is a nice spot to enjoy one of their selection of national and international cocktails on their menu, entertained by piano music. Another one of their features is the business centre, which includes several conference rooms for all sorts of events.

basicData.name: Me Madrid Reina Victoria
basicData.title: Me Madrid Reina Victoria
basicData.body:
Right in the centre of Madrid, a short walk away from Puerta del Sol and the Golden Triangle of Art, and located in one of the most charming plazas in the city, Hotel Me Madrid is the latest initiative by group Sol Meliá. The former Reina Victoria hotel is reborn as the new Me Madrid, an avant-garde hotel, which has become an icon of contemporary design in the heart of traditional Madrid.

The famous “bullfighter” hotel maintained its original façade while completely refurbishing its interior. It now boasts an eclectic decor, combining exclusive designer furniture with contemporary artwork and neutral colours. To top it off, lounge music creates an atmosphere that perfectly matches the hotel’s philosophy.

Me Madrid also features a restaurant and a lounge bar for those who like to follow the latest trends. The former, Midnight Rose, combines international cuisine with a stunning design. On the other hand, the trendy lounge bar, The Penthouse, offers one of the most spectacular views of Madrid.

basicData.name: Meliá Avenida América
basicData.title: Meliá Avenida América
basicData.body:
Since it opened, Meliá Avenida de América has focused on making business travellers feel at home during their stay in the capital. Thanks to its location, it is a perfect choice for this type of guests, since it sits between the airport and Paseo de la Castellana, in one of the areas with the most expansion and business activity in Madrid. Furthermore, it is very close to Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I and just 15 minutes away from both Atocha and Chamartín train stations.

This four-star hotel features a business centre to make guests’ jobs easier. But they also offer other services so that they can make the best of their free time: indoor and outdoor pool, sauna, gym and Jacuzzi, as well as their restaurant. However, those who would rather leave the building will find a wide range of options in the vicinity: shops, businesses, a golf course, movie theatres, restaurants, an area for jogging and an ice-skating rink.

basicData.name: Meliá Barajas
basicData.title: Meliá Barajas
basicData.body:
Meliá Barajas is the ideal choice for business travellers or for those who have layovers and need to spend a night in the city. However it is also a good option for visitors who are travelling for pleasure and look to stay at a peaceful hotel, removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. It is located in a residential area near Barajas Airport, very close to the Juan Carlos I trade fair grounds , yet well connected with the city centre.

Their goal is to offer every guest a personalized service, and for that reason the hotel provides them with different ways to enjoy their stay and make the best of their time at the hotel. Those coming for business can make use of their over 1,000 square feet destined to meetings and other events. Those who would like to make use of their free time can access the swimming-pool or go by the golf course near the building. The outdoor pool is another of their defining features, both for its size and its surroundings: a lovely garden with trees and grass. This is no small concrete pond: it's a proper pool that allows for proper summer fun.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Arturo Soria
basicData.title: Petit Palace Arturo Soria
basicData.body:
Business travellers, families and small groups are the most frequent guests at Petit Palace Arturo Soria. Executives can take advantage of its proximity to the Palacio Municipal de Congresos and Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I as well as to the airport. Other guests can find in this boutique hotel rooms to suit their needs, all of them including a double sofa bed.

One of its major perks is the peace and quiet found in this residential area. Furthermore, the facilities feature the latest technology, and the rooms offer extra details, such as a cutting-edge hydro-massage shower.

basicData.name: Petit Palace Madrid Aeropuerto
basicData.title: Petit Palace Madrid Aeropuerto
basicData.body:
Inaugurated in 2003, Petit Palace Madrid Aeropuerto is a modern hotel, perfect for travellers who need to spend a night in Madrid due to their flight connections. It is also ideal for executives or for anyone coming to the many fairs and conventions that are held in the capital. Conveniently located less than five minutes away from the airport, it is very close to the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I (trade fair grounds) and the Palacio Municipal de Congresos (municipal convention centre) as well.

In order to help business travelers work at ease, this hotel has a business centre and its facilities feature the latest technology. There are also executive rooms available to guests, which are specially designed for them. To make the best out of their free time, guests can also enjoy the swimming pool, which is an indoor pool in the winter and an outdoor pool during the summer months, and sunbathe on the solarium.

basicData.name: Gran Hotel Velázquez
basicData.title: Gran Hotel Velázquez
basicData.body:
Gran Hotel Velázquez is a four-star hotel located in the Salamanca neighbourhood, a sophisticated area close to the financial district as well as the financial, political and commercial area of the capital.

It is oriented towards a demanding clientele, looking for exclusive accommodation in an aristocratic atmosphere featuring all the services of a hotel of its class. Thus, Gran Hotel Velázquez is a good choice both for business travelers, for whom it offers several conference rooms, and for tourists or visitors looking to shop at the fanciest boutiques.

basicData.name: Gran Hotel Conde Duque
basicData.title: Gran Hotel Conde Duque
basicData.body:
Gran Hotel Conde Duque opened its doors in 1953 in a building located in Plaza del Conde Valle de Suchil, which had been declared singular by Madrid's City Council. This peaceful, green area is well connected with all the interesting sites, yet removed from the noise and hustle and bustle of the city.

Gran Hotel Conde Duque has always been particularly concerned about wine culture. It is directly related to two Spanish wineries and makes a continuous effort to provide its customers with an extensive wine selection. Tea is another one of the hotel's specialties. Every afternoon their Tea Room offers a long list of cold and hot teas to choose from, depending on the season. Another curious fact and service provided by the hotel is their library, set up with the books left behind by guests.

basicData.name: NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado
basicData.title: NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado
basicData.body:
This hotel is located in a building from 1904 in the historic centre of Madrid, beside the "Golden Triangle" (the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofía Museums). Close to the Congreso de los Diputados, the CaixaForum convention centre and the Botanic Gardens, as well at the Atocha station (AVE).

This prime location not only allows hotel clients to conveniently visit these museums, but also gives the option of exploring the many attractions that make Madrid one of the most charismatic cities in Spain.

Its ample and modern rooms and facilities include their own bathroom, hairdryer, air conditioning, central heating, direct line telephone, satellite TV, minibar, safe and Internet connection. There are standard rooms, superior rooms and junior suites. Catering is one of the hotel chain's priorities, as it offers guests top quality cuisine. In this respect, the prestigious restauranteur Paco Roncero is responsible for the bar-restaurant.

Description of function rooms:

The hotel offers four conference and meeting rooms fitted with the best technological and audiovisual equipment, with a capacity of 150 persons.

basicData.name: Holiday Inn Madrid - Las Tablas
basicData.title: Holiday Inn Madrid - Las Tablas
basicData.body:
High Tech Nueva Castellana is a recently built four-star hotel which is quickly becoming one of the favourite options for executives who are in town for business.

One of the main reasons for this is its location, in the business area of Fuencarral, Chamartín, and the extension of Paseo de la Castellana. But also, its facilities are equipped with the latest technology and its rooms feature details such as a workout bike, a cutting-edge hydro-massage shower and a sauna. Families and small groups are also frequent guests at this hotel, especially since rooms are furnished to suit all their needs, and each one has a sofa bed sleeping two people.

basicData.name: Petit Palace President Castellana
basicData.title: Petit Palace President Castellana
basicData.body:
