Petit Palace President is an ultramodern hotel both when it comes to its decor and to its equipment, noteworthy in a classical environment such as the Salamanca neighbourhood, where it stands. From the outside, the large spotlights illuminating the buildings façade already give an idea of what can be found in its interior: innovation and design in a space where lighting and the latest technologies are predominant.

Once inside, guests will find the very latest in furniture, leather headboards for beds and nightstands in glass, which is also the star material for bathrooms, all in a very urban and functional style. Particularly interesting is the lighting in the underside of the bed, highlighted even more by the dark curtains which isolate the bedroom, and the effects of the lights coming in from the large back yard. Amongst the many comforts of this hotel, worth noting is the very modern bathtub with hydro-massage which some of the rooms feature. This is one way of relaxing after working out on the exercise bike guests will find in their own room.

basicData.name: H10 Villa de la Reina
basicData.title: H10 Villa de la Reina
basicData.body:
H10 Villa de la Reina is located on Gran Vía, the most cosmopolitan area in the city, right in the heart of the city, and just steps away from the culture and entertainment offer. This four-star hotel is ideal for those who wish to explore the city or attend any of the shows or musicals currently on.

This is a young hotel, inaugurated in 2001, and located in a 20th-century Madrilenian-style building, whose interior was completely refurbished in order to house a four-star hotel. Its restaurant, Villa de la Reina, offers a varied menu featuring Mediterranean authors cuisine.

basicData.name: Madrid Marriot Auditórium
basicData.title: Auditorium Madrid Hotel
basicData.body:
Auditorium is a hotel specialized in conferences, geared towards the business traveller. Inaugurated in 2002, most of its facilities are designed to host meetings, conventions and events in general.

Its Príncipe Felipe convention centre  features an auditorium with capacity for up to 2,400 people. Furthermore, it has 40 conference rooms in different sizes, fully equipped to host all sorts of meetings and conventions. Inevitably, it is located in one of the major business areas, close to the Juan Carlos I Trade Fair grounds and Barajas airport. This four-star hotel, as well as helping guests work with ease, also offers numerous services to make their stay as comfortable as possible. The indoor pool and their gym are amongst these facilities.

basicData.name: Barceló Torre Arias
basicData.title: Barceló Torre Arias
basicData.body:
Barceló Torre Arias is an innovative and functional hotel, recently built and inaugurated in 2005. Located on calle Alcalá, in the area closest to the airport and Madrid's trade fair grounds, it is equipped with cutting-edge technology, so that guests can work at ease.

In this sense, it offers a cyber corner, along with free internet access. Gastronomy is another one of this four-star hotel's fortes. Its restaurant, El Hayedo, features a cuisine that ranges from the most traditional Madrilenian recipes to the most creative Mediterranean dishes. Also, in its Lobby bar, guests can relax while sipping a drink. They can also relax after their day of work at the hotel's gym and sauna.

Rooms:

Total number of rooms: 108 (100 standard double rooms; 4 handicapped accessible rooms; 4 Junior Suites).

basicData.name: Confortel Alcalá Norte
basicData.title: Confortel Alcalá Norte
basicData.body:
Confortel Alcalá Norte is a four-star hotel geared towards business travelers. It offers all the comforts of a hotel of its class and modern facilities, as well as extra services for its business facility and several conference rooms so that guests can work at ease.

It is located in the north-eastern area of the city, just a few minutes away from Barajas airport and the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I (IFEMA trade fair grounds). It features restaurant El Fogón, offering a Mediterranean cuisine based on fresh produce and with a selection of wines from different Spanish regions.

basicData.name: Confortel Pío XII
basicData.title: Confortel Pío XII
basicData.body:
Inaugurated in 2002 Confortel Pío XII is a four-star hotel geared towards business travellers. It offers all the comforts of a hotel of its class and modern facilities, as well as extra Business facilities and several conference rooms so that guests can work at ease.

It is conveniently located at the end of Avenida Pío XII, close to Chamartín train station, and directly accessible from M-30 North bypass. It is also well connected with the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I (trade fair grounds), with Barajas Airport and with the historical centre.

basicData.name: Catalonia Puerta del Sol
basicData.title: Catalonia Puerta del Sol
basicData.body:
The most striking feature of Hotel Catalonia Puerta del Sol is the majestic building in which it is housed. It was one of the first properties in the area, built in the late 18th century, which has since been completely refurbished and modernized.

Everything has been restored and maintained as it was originally: the hallway, which is the former access road; the magnificent entrance doors, still showcasing their original ironwork; the grand staircase, featuring its wood steps and balustrade with plaster mouldings and the courtyard, typical in Madrid in those times, where it is said that the local chulapos from the neighbourhood would come to smoke and talk to the women. This hotel blends in perfectly with the Literary Quarter. The rest has been completely renovated to achieve the desired modern and elegant image and the necessary facilities to ensure a comfortable and pleasant stay.

basicData.name: Catalonia Gran Vía
basicData.title: Catalonia Gran Vía
basicData.body:
Located on the emblematic Gran Vía/Sol area, the Catalonia Gran Vía hotel  is housed in an eclectic building from the early 20th century, of which the original façade and marble grand staircase were maintained. Hence, this building preserves the charm of a historical building while adding to it the necessary amount of innovation to make it a 21st-century four-star hotel.

As well as being surrounded by endless entertainment possibilities, the hotel offers guests its Jacuzzi, sauna, gym and massage service, so that they can relax after a work day or rest after a busy day of sightseeing or shopping. In terms of gastronomy, the hotel's restaurant, La Pedrera, offers a selection of Catalan and international dishes.

basicData.name: Best Western Arosa
basicData.title: Best Western Arosa
basicData.body:
Best Western Arosa takes you to the heart of Japan right in the centre of Madrid. For that purpose it features rooms decorated and equipped in an Asian style: the bed is a tatami, there are Japanese stations on the TV and guests are offered  a selection of teas.

Breakfast can also be enjoyed in a truly Japanese fashion, as the buffet has a section offering Japanese gastronomy. And their restaurant at street level, 19 Sushi Bar, includes in its menu some of the most avant-garde proposals from the cuisine of the Land of the Rising Sun. The contrast comes from the hotel’s location itself. Just by stepping outside, guests will find themselves in a genuinely Madrilenian environment, Gran Vía, which is one of the landmarks of the capital, just steps away from entertainment, culture and tourism.

basicData.name: AC Carlton
basicData.title: AC Carlton
basicData.body:
Hotel Carlton, built in 1959 and renovated in 2010, is a good option for art lovers, as it is located in the heart of the arts offer in the city. This four-star hotel is surrounded by the three major museums, the Prado, the Thyssen and the Reina Sofía, as well as numerous art galleries.

Furthermore, thanks to its privileged location close to Atocha train station, it is a perfect spot for travellers who wish to visit the cities surrounding Madrid by train, or those arriving at Atocha station. Inside the hotel, the restaurant La Galerie is another place to enjoy, as well as other communal areas such as the fitness centre. On the whole, the hotel takes care of every little detail to create a comfortable yet elegant atmosphere.

basicData.name: Clement Barajas
basicData.title: Clement Barajas
basicData.body:
Hotel Clement Barajas, in the Airport / IFEMA area of Madrid opened its doors in 2005 for very specific type of guest: visitors coming to the trade fairs and conventions and those who need a place to stay due to their flight connections. This modern and functional hotel was built with these guests in mind.

For that reason, its location could be no other than the surroundings of Barajas Airport and the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I (IFEMA Trade Fair grounds). The hotel has an added value: its service. In this sense, restaurant Miravalles is a sure bet. Its menu offers a traditional Asturian cuisine with natural produce and high quality, specialized in  wild fish and seasonal seafood.

basicData.name: Catalonia Goya
basicData.title: Catalonia Goya
basicData.body:
Hotel Catalonia Centro has adapted perfectly to the exclusive atmosphere of the Salamanca neighbourhood where it is located, a good choice both for visitors who are in town for business and for those who are travelling for pleasure, as well as an ideal option for lovers of haute-couture and luxury.

In order to get established in this area, the hotel chose a 19th-century building located on calle Goya which respects the architectural environment. On the outside, the glass-paned balconies covered by wrought iron stand out on the brick façade. Its interior features dark designers’ furniture contrasting with their red sofas and complements. The rooms have a very modern and functional decor and include Japanese-inspired bathrooms.

basicData.name: Catalonia Las Cortes
basicData.title: Catalonia Las Cortes
basicData.body:
Hotel Catalonia Las Cortes has combined the tradition of its neighbourhood and the history of a building with all the innovations of a 21st-century four-star hotel. Precisely its location, in the Literary Quarter, and the neoclassical 18th-century mansion where it is housed are its strong points.

This hotel is the perfect choice for anyone who wishes to explore the most authentic and traditional side of Madrid, both at night and during the day, as well as the major tourist sites in the city, as it is right next to Plaza de Santa Ana. The hotel has made the best of the building’s grandiosity, which is the former residence of the Duke of Noblejas, and has maintained all the frescoes of the interior as well as the main staircase and the wood mouldings. The decor is very much in line with this classic style, in harmony with the rest of the building.

basicData.name: Convención
basicData.title: Convención
basicData.body:
Hotel Convención is located in one of the most elegant shopping areas in Madrid, very close to El Retiro park and well connected with the major tourist areas in the city as well as the financial and business district.

As its name suggests, this hotel offers several rooms where meetings can be held, as well as conferences and celebrations, featuring everything necessary for all sorts of events. It also features a Business Centre, for visitors coming to Madrid for business. Hotel guests can choose from a wide range of gastronomic offers, since the hotel includes two breakfast rooms, El Roble restaurant à la carte and the coffee shop-bar La Terraza.

basicData.name: Ayre Gran Hotel Colón
basicData.title: Ayre Gran Hotel Colón
basicData.body:
Ayre Gran Hotel Colón opened its doors in the 60's, but was renovated in 2010. It is located near the famous El Retiro park, one of the city's major attractions and is an ideal hotel for small conventions, up to 350 people.

This four-star hotel is particularly noteworthy for the stained-glass windows and the frescoes decorating the meeting rooms, lobbies, coffee-shop and restaurants, by artist Manuel Ortega, best known for his stained-glass windows in La Almudena Cathedral. In general, the lighting is modern and exquisite and light is the main feature. As far as dining, guests have a wide range of options to choose from, in any of the three restaurants in the hotel, where they can pick between eating à la carte, having a prix fixé menu or from the buffet. The latter offers the option of combining the classical buffet option for starters and desserts while also choosing from four main entrees.

basicData.name: Abba Madrid
basicData.title: Abba Madrid
basicData.body:
ABBA Madrid is a modern and functional hotel, inside and out. Inaugurated in 2003, it is conveniently located in the business area around Avenida de América, in the Salamanca neighbourhood but well connected with Barajas Airport and IFEMA Trade Fair grounds. It is also close to the National Music Auditorium, the exclusive boutiques in the Golden Mile and the entertainment on Paseo de la Castellana.

This four-star hotel is particularly oriented to business clients. The hotel provides a series of executive rooms including VIP service and a special event-planning team. In terms of gastronomy, this hotel considers breakfast to be an important meal, hence serving a buffet in which Mediterranean produce is the key. Its restaurant, AbbaMia, also features Mediterranean cuisine, with a menu specialized in Italian dishes with a Spanish touch.

basicData.name: Meliá Madrid Princesa
basicData.title: Meliá Madrid Princesa
basicData.body:
Hotel Meliá Princesa is one of those ideal hotels for visitors wanting to discover the most authentic Madrid, as it is in the heart of the city, just a few steps away from Plaza de España and Gran Vía. Shopping lovers will also enjoy its prime location in the centre of one of the city’s major shopping areas.

The hotel offers a relaxing plan to round off the day after a morning of shopping or sightseeing, with its indoor pool, spa and body care area with jacuzzi, sauna, solarium, Turkish bath and massage service, gym and a varied programme of activities. Built in 1967 and completely refurbished in 1998, the building combines innovation with the traditional luxury of grand hotels, and features exquisite furniture, marble floors, large Persian rugs and Chinese vases.

One of its major appeals is UNO by Meliá Madrid Princesa restaurant, specialising in Mediterranean signature cuisine. The bar area serves light but sophisticated snacks.

basicData.name: Adler
basicData.title: Adler
basicData.body:
On the corner of Calle Goya and Calle Velázquez, one of the most exclusive areas in the capital, is Hotel Adler, a fully refurbished hotel equipped with the very latest facilities.

Decorated by renowned interior designer Pascual Ortega, the hotel has taken on a whole new dimension, without detracting from its 18th century charm. Ortega points out that the lighting has had an important role to play as a way of highlighting contrasts between the various areas and emphasizing certain decorative and architectural features. In order to give the hotel a distinctive and exclusive touch, the designer has opted for original designs and quality in terms of both the materials used and the furnishings selected.

basicData.name: Gran Meliá Fénix
basicData.title: Gran Meliá Fénix
basicData.body:
Located right in Plaza de Colón, in the heart of the city’s financial district and surrounded by the streets of Goya, Serrano and Paseo de la Castellana, Hotel Gran Meliá Fénix is one of the capital’s grand luxury hotels. Its fantastic location makes it ideal for tourists, business visitors or people wanting to shop at the most exclusive boutiques.

The hotel was originally opened in September 1953 and then completely refurbished in 2001. The Neoclassical exterior is complemented by the palatial interior decor, in keeping with its the atmosphere.

Many celebrities have stayed at this hotel, including Gregory Peck, who attended the inauguration, Gloria Swanson, Rita Hayworth, Cary Grant and Charles Bronson, all of whom were captivated by its classic decor and aristocratic splendour. However, the most memorable guests were probably the Beatles, who visited Madrid in 1965 to give their one and only concert here and stayed at the Gran Meliá Fénix.

basicData.name: Hesperia Madrid
basicData.title: Hesperia Madrid
basicData.body:
Located in the heart of Paseo de la Castellana, Hotel Hesperia is particularly well-suited for top executives given its excellent transport links to Barajas Airport, the Madrid trade fair complex and the city’s commercial area.

The decor is halfway between classic and modern, courtesy of Pascua Ortega, and its sumptuous bedrooms make this one of the capital’s finest hotels. It provides 24-hour room service and its suites include a butler service to make clients feel perfectly at home.

The restaurants are particularly good and serve food to suit all tastes. La Manzana restaurant offers typically Mediterranean dishes, while Santceloni, under the guidance of Óscar Velasco, specialises in haute cuisine.

basicData.name: Hotel Wellington
basicData.title: Wellington Hotel
basicData.body:
The Salamanca district, in the heart of Madrid’s commercial and business area, is a place of luxury and glamour and also home to this five-star hotel. El Retiro park, Puerta de Alcalá and the Art Walk are all part of the five-star surroundings.

The Wellington has 251 stylish, cosy rooms decorated in the classical style. It features all the services guests can expect of a five-star hotel: 24-hour business centre, free Wi-Fi in the entire hotel, hair salon, laundry, cloakroom and private parking. In addition, it offers special facilities for a unique stay, like the exclusive wellness centre Le Max Wellness Club Wellington, with fitness area, hydro-massage pool, ice fountain, sensation and contrast shower, steam bath, sauna, health and beauty treatments, fitness studio and rest area.

In the summer, the outdoor pool and the whirlpool tub are most refreshing places to relax in. The hotel has amazing dining options at the Michelin-starred Kabuki Wellington and the Goizeko Wellington restaurants, as well as in the outdoor terrace. The Sunday branch is a great way to get ready for the coming week. There are 13 rooms with natural light and Wi-Fi to hold meetings, exhibitions, conventions and private meals.

basicData.name: AC Aravaca
basicData.title: AC Aravaca
basicData.body:
AC Aravaca is an ideal hotel for visitors who are looking to disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city and who wish to stay in a peaceful and cosy environment. It is located in the Camino de la Zarzuela area, opposite Hospital de la Zarzuela, but is well connected both to the city centre, if guests are staying for tourism, and to the business area in the northwest, for those who are in town for business.

The surroundings of this four-star hotel offer options to suit all tastes. For those who enjoy nature and the outdoors, Casa de Campo is nearby. And for those who are more interested in shopping, watching a movie or dining out in their free time, the shopping centre Avenida M-40 is also close by. Furthermore, the hotel has its own restaurant, as well as the AC Room and a Turkish bath, for guests who would rather not leave the building.

basicData.name: AC Cuzco
basicData.title: AC Cuzco
basicData.body:
Hotel AC Cuzco is a perfect choice for soccer fans who are in town to watch a Real Madrid game which, in turn, is the perfect excuse to spend a weekend in the capital. It is located just metres away from Santiago Bernabéu stadium and, at the same time, well connected to the city centre.

During the week, this four-star hotel is ideal for business travelers, since it stands right in the heart of the financial and business district. It provides an elegant and sophisticated decor, a centre for business and other features providing guests with relaxation and comfort, such as a Turkish bath and their restaurant, Belmecher, specialized in traditional Navarrian cuisine.

basicData.name: The Westin Palace
basicData.title: The Westin Palace
basicData.body:
Built in 1912 at the former site of the palace of the Duke and Duchess of Medinaceli, and decorated in the same style as the grand Parisian buildings of the Belle Époque, it was, at the time, the largest and most luxurious hotel in Europe.

The hotel has been frequented by artists, intellectuals and politicians. Its records feature renowned names such as painter Ignacio de Zuloaga, who made the Palace his home in Madrid, writer Vicente Blasco Ibáñez and even the mysterious Mata-Hari, who lived at the hotel and whose adventurous spirit, some say, still walks certain rooms.

Other famous guests include Buster Keaton, Pablo Picasso, Federico García Lorca and Luis Buñuel. The hotel also welcomed Dolores del Río, Orson Welles with Rita Hayworth, Hemingway and his famous dry martinis and bullfighters such as Belmonte, El Gallo and Manolete, who left the Palace dressed in their bullfighting costumes on their way to Las Ventas bullring. Apparently, one of the hotel’s most interesting guests was a still relatively unknown Salvador Dalí.

basicData.name: Villa Real
basicData.title: Villa Real
basicData.body:
In recent years, there has been an increasing trend for small, stylish hotels that concentrate on fantastic customer service, making them an ideal refuge after a day of business or pleasure. Hotel Villa Real is one such place. Based near the Parliament building and only a short walk away from the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia Museums, it has a classical design and one of the finest private collections of Roman mosaics and Ampuria vases dating from the 3rd and 4th centuries AD.

Built in the 19th century, the hotel has since undergone a series of refurbishments. There are some amazing views from its terraces over the Retiro Park and the Botanical Gardens. In its grand luxury rooms, decorated with 19th century furniture, French fabrics, Carrara marble and Swedish hardwood floors, guests will find a warm, comfortable and discreet atmosphere.

The hotel's East 47 restaurant has won various awards over the last few years and is a great place to enjoy first-class signature cuisine while contemplating original Warhol artworks.

basicData.name: AC Los Vascos
basicData.title: AC Los Vascos
basicData.body:
Hotel AC Los Vascos is a small modern hotel, ideal for those who need to stay around the university; located in the University area of the city, it is a good choice for both students and faculty who are in town to attend any of Madrid's universities. It is housed in an avant-garde and functional building and surrounded by a green and peaceful environment.

To make the best out of their free time, guests have a new concept available: the AC Room. This is a leisure space which can be used for work, or to relax, have a snack or a drink, read the paper or a book or watch TV.

basicData.name: AC Recoletos
basicData.title: AC Recoletos
basicData.body:
A good location and a perfect combination between a historic building and a cosmopolitan interior design are two of Hotel AC Recoletos's perks. Standing between Calle Serrano and Paseo de Recoletos, it is a good starting point both for visitors who are in town for tourism and for business travelers.

The interior of this neoclassical 19th-century building provides AC Recoletos with a modern atmosphere, achieved through dark wood furniture, 70's-style leather armchairs and the predominance of black and white. A very contemporary atmosphere, recommended for those who are looking for the latest trends in decor and design. In terms of other features to make this a perfect stay, there are the traditional ones as well as those more in style, such as  the fitness centre.

basicData.name: Vincci SoMa
basicData.title: Vincci SoMa
basicData.body:
Vincci SoMa is located in the centre of the city, in the Salamanca neighbourhood, surrounded by business, shopping, culture and entertainment sites. Its interior features a peaceful and comfortable atmosphere thanks to a combination of innovation, functionality, comfort and style.

Its restaurant SoMa is one of its major attractions, overlooking calle Goya from its windows. Its linen table cloths and designer china, along with decor which always includes fresh flowers and candles, combine with a menu filled with surprises every week, based on a creative Mediterranean cuisine. The hotel also includes several rooms designed for business meetings, as well as several spaces for family celebrations or reunions.

basicData.name: AC Santo Mauro
basicData.title: AC Santo Mauro
basicData.body:
Located in a luxurious 19th-century building whose interior has been renovated and refurbished, Hotel AC Santo Mauro was inaugurated just a few years ago. Named after the Marquis who once resided in this mansion, it is right in the heart of the city, very close to Paseo de la Castellana.

One of the gems of this hotel is the 1,000 square-metre garden in which you will find beautiful rosebushes, eucalypti and horse chestnuts, creating a Parisian atmosphere in keeping with the interior decor. A particularly attractive room is the oak-panelled former library, now turned into a restaurant, and what once were the ballrooms, used nowadays as meeting rooms. The different rooms in the hotel combine a modern style in which glass, steel and wenge wood are predominant, with a more classical touch for those who love old-fashioned luxury, including marble fireplaces, vintage prints and vibrant colours.

basicData.name: AC Palacio del Retiro
basicData.title: AC Palacio del Retiro
basicData.body:
As part of its commitment to finding unusual and unique buildings for their premises in every city, the AC hotel chain has refurbished a former early 20th-century palace, a National Heritage site, turning it into a five-star hotel. Located within the Golden Triangle of Art formed by the Prado, the Reina Sofía and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, the AC Palacio del Retiro hotel also boasts magnificent views over this famous park. But its privileged location is by no means its sole appeal. The classical style of its façade contrasts with the sleek contemporary decor found inside. As they enter the hotel, guests can admire the very latest in new decorative elements and art objects.

Built in concrete, horizontal wrought iron girders and carved wood, the materials and architectural elements in this four-storey building have been preserved as much as possible. According to Lorenzo Marqués, the architect responsible for the interior design of the hotel, it was designed with a minimalist idea in mind, searching for a balance between a traditional building and the latest interior design trends.

basicData.name: InterContinental Madrid
basicData.title: InterContinental Madrid
basicData.body:
Considered one of the best business hotels in the capital, InterContinental Hotel Madrid offers all the exclusive services you would expect in a luxury hotel catering for business travellers. However, its prime location, close to the main museums and the Santiago Bernabéu stadium, also makes the hotel an excellent choice for people wanting to enjoy Madrid’s culture and entertainment scene.

The hotel was built in the mid-20th century on the site of a 18th century mansion on Paseo de la Castellana, and has always been inspired by Madrid’s exquisite artistic tradition. Over the years it has embraced new technologies, specialising in business clients, for whom the luxurious Club InterContinental floor has been added, as well as 17 sunlit meeting rooms.

Gastronomy is another one of the hotel’s strong points. InterContinental’s Bar 49 is  a great place for people looking for an informal atmosphere where they can enjoy cocktails and light tapas. For those looking to eat à la carte, El Jardín del InterContinental restaurant, under the management of Chef José Luque, offers a carefully selected menu that can also be enjoyed at the open-air terrace in summer. Their Sunday brunch, with more than 200 specials, is a true banquet for gourmets and families alike.

basicData.name: Sheraton Madrid Mirasierra Hotel & Spa
basicData.title: Sheraton Madrid Mirasierra Hotel & Spa
basicData.body:
Sheraton Madrid Mirasierra Hotel & Spa is located in a quiet residential area, a stone’s throw from the Cuatro Torres business area, Paseo de la Castellana and Chamartín train station, and a mere 15-minute drive from Barajas airport and the Feria de Madrid (IFEMA) trade fair complex.

Its 180 rooms have all the features you would expect to find in this renowned hotel chain, including the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed ®. The Verdil restaurant is open every day, and the Lobby Bar, the outdoor summer bar and the poolside lounge bar are all perfect for enjoying a bite to eat or a cool drink in the evening. Hotel guests can also use the Sheraton Fitness powered by Core Performance, a large spa with an indoor and an outdoor pool.

The hotel has over 1,300 square metres of meeting and conference rooms, including an 850 m2 hall and 8 fully equipped meeting rooms to cater for business travellers. The hotel also has a Sheraton Club and Club Lounge rooms and a convenient “connection destination”, the Link@SheratonSM experienced with Microsoft.

The hotel, which opened in 2003 and was previously known as the Mirasierra Suites Hotel & Spa, is part of the Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) loyalty programme.

basicData.name: Hotel Princesa
basicData.title: Husa Princesa
basicData.body:
Hotel Husa Princesa is among the first of Madrid's hotels to find the perfect balance between good taste and the avant-garde, in which decorative elements take pride of place, without detracting from standards of customer service.

Inaugurated on the 1st of September 1976 in Princesa, one of the capital's most emblematic commercial and financial districts, and very close to the major tourist attractions and entertainment venues, it is committed to a constant search for innovation as well as a environmental conservation.

Since its early years, its innovative aesthetic design has been based on the use of natural materials such as cherry tree wood, rice paper and bamboo. However, one of the hotel's most noteworthy features, especially for art lovers, is that each room is something of a miniature Prado Museum, depicting some of the most emblematic works from the prestigious museum.

basicData.name: Hotel Miguel Ángel
basicData.title: Occidental Miguel Ángel
basicData.body:
Hotel Occidental Miguel Ángel’s classic style is enhanced by the valuable works of art featured inside. It was opened in 1977 by Queen Sofía when she was still Princess of Spain. Its privileged location grants it access to Madrid’s financial district and the luxury boutiques in the Salamanca neighbourhood. This was one of the first hotels to provide exclusive services for special guests, and boasts a spa with hydrotherapy circuits including an indoor pool, jacuzzi, Finnish sauna, Turkish bath and essence shower.

Gastronomy also plays a major role in this hotel, as its restaurant, La Broche, is under the guidance of renowned Chef Sergi Arola and has been awarded two Michelin stars. Hotel Occidental Miguel Ángel has been the choice of many celebrities, amongst others, famous actors like Jeremy Irons and Ewan McGregor, and other celebrities such as Placido Domingo, Peter Gabriel and Cher. But there will always be a special place in the hotel’s memory for winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature Camilo José Cela, who used to stay at the hotel every week.

Former US president Bill Clinton’s visit is also a hotel favourite. He stayed at the hotel in 1997 during a 5-day visit to Spain with his family. The hotel was occupied in its entirety by the US presidential entourage and became the safest place in the world. In order for the Clinton family to feel comfortable, the hotel built a suite, specially adapted to suit their needs. One of the rooms was turned into a large walk-in wardrobe for the exclusive use of Hillary Clinton and her personal stylist. But that was not all, their entourage included a personal butler, who was assigned to the kitchen and who tasted everything that the Clinton family would eat.

basicData.name: Orfila
basicData.title: Orfila
basicData.body:
Hotel Orfila is one of those places where you feel as if you have been transported to another time the minute you walk through the door. From the outside you can already imagine the interior, as it occupies a 19th century mansion on the street after which it is named, in one of the city’s most charming areas, the Chamberí district.

Once inside, the decor and the style confirm your initial impression. Original features such as the staircase and the hallway, wall coverings and antique furniture make for a predominantly classical atmosphere. Every room in the hotel is unique, each with an original design and decor, but they all have something in common: they take you right back to the 19th century, but with all the comforts of a modern hotel.

The style in the rest of the hotel is also palatial. The tea room, the conference room, its English-style bar and the restaurant, El Jardín de Orfila, complete this luxury experience of a bygone era. Maybe this is why Hotel Orfila is the only hotel in Madrid to be managed by the approximately 400 hotels in the Relais & Châteaux chain, which includes some of the most prestigious small hotels in the world.

basicData.name: Meliá Castilla
basicData.title: Meliá Castilla
basicData.body:
Located in Madrid's financial district, Hotel Meliá Castilla is just a few steps away from Paseo de la Castellana and from Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, and just a few minutes away from the airport, IFEMA trade fair grounds, the Convention Centre, Chamartín train station and the capital's historical centre. Thanks to its prime location as well as to the 4,000 square metres destined to conference rooms and lecture halls, this hotel is considered one of Europe's most modern convention centres.

The hotel offers 33 conference rooms, including an auditorium with 511 seats, , spacious halls, reception desks and offices. As well as this, and keeping in mind the business traveler, the hotel boasts two exclusive floors called The Level, conceived as a small grand luxury hotel within a five-star hotel, ideal for those who are looking for the maximum comfort in an comprehensive business centre. Additionally, the hotel has an outdoor swimming pool at the disposal of its clientele during the summer months, located at the roof top, where one can enojy a drink and watch Madrid’s amazing sunset.

basicData.name: Silken Puerta América
basicData.title: Silken Puerta América
basicData.body:
As well as being a grand luxury hotel and an icon of modernity, Puerta de América is a meeting point where different cultures and ways of understanding architecture and design come together.

Inaugurated in 2006, the building had nineteen of the best architecture and design studios from thirteen different countries participating in the design. The project entailed playing with different materials, colours and shapes in order to create unique spaces which encompass the best of avant-garde design and architecture, and where all artists have had complete creative freedom.

The idea was to create a unique hotel reflecting different perspectives on architecture, design and art, and a series of great names were commissioned to achieve this, including Jean Nouvel, who is also responsible for the top floor and the colourful façade, Javier Mariscal and Fernando Salas, Richard Gluckman, Victorio & Lucchino, Norman Foster and Zaha Hadid. The result is an original, innovative and luxurious hotel, experimental and eclectic, where guests can discover a different creative universe with each visit.

basicData.name: AC Aitana
basicData.title: AC Aitana
basicData.body:
Hotel AC Aitana offers guests a peaceful and quiet atmosphere, whether they are business travellers, tourists or visitors in town for a game at the nearby Santiago Bernabéu stadium. This is the basis of this four-star hotel's philosophy, and is achieved through a modern and functional decor, based on soft colours and predominantly light woods, creating a relaxed ambiance in which every exquisite detail counts.

Its restaurant, of the same name, Aitana, is another one of the hotel's strong points. In line with the rest of the premises, it features a warm and innovative feel and specializes in à la carte breakfasts and business dining. Its menu is determined by seasonal produce, always with a home-style touch.

basicData.name: Ritz Madrid
basicData.title: Ritz Madrid
basicData.body:
Well-known for being a favourite of European royalty, Hotel Ritz was officially opened on 2 October 1910 by King Alfonso XII to satisfy the need to provide accommodation for the nobility and celebrities of the day. A hundred years later, it continues to welcome famous names from the worlds of politics, culture and the arts in an exceptional location in Madrid’s “Art Triangle”.

The many Royal Households who have used this hotel include the Monaco royal family, as well as the Maharaja of Kapurthala and his wife, the Prince and Princess of Wales, and the Duke of Windsor and his wife. Stars of the silver screen such as Henry Fonda, Cary Grant, Orson Welles, Rita Hayworth, Sofia Loren, Elisabeth Taylor, Richard Gere, Warren Beatty, Mel Gibson, Jodie Foster and Julia Roberts have also stayed at this distinguished hotel.

The twenty years during which actress Ava Gardner chose this hotel when she stayed in Spain, and when Frank Sinatra dropped by, have now been consigned to history. Linda Fiorentino, the femme fatale of American film, who has stayed at the Ritz several times, says that every time she comes to the hotel, her excitement at being able to see the Prado Museum with the statue of Apollo at the entrance keeps her awake at night.

The hotel's restaurants and bars are a favourite meeting place for Spanish high society and the function rooms host major social events that attract widespread media coverage.  Its garden terrace is particularly popular during the summer months and is the perfect setting for an exclusive Sunday brunch.

basicData.name: Monte Real
basicData.title: Monte Real
basicData.body:
Built in 1969 and renovated in 2006, this five-star hotel is inspired by the French and Swiss relais. Gastronomy is its forte. Its restaurant offers a menu composed of simple dishes prepared with market produce, to be enjoyed in its peaceful and exquisite atmosphere.

Hotel AC Monte Real is located in the pleasant area of Puerta de Hierro, a 15-minute drive away from the city, thus offering a relaxing atmosphere, far from the hustle and bustle of the city, surrounded by gardens and provided with sports facilities and a swimming-pool, all of which is available to guests. Golf lovers will also appreciate the fact that the hotel is just a few metres away from a golf course.

basicData.name: AC Madrid Feria
basicData.title: AC Madrid Feria
basicData.body:
Hotel AC Feria de Madrid is, first and foremost, a business hotel. It is ideal for executives and business people who are in town to participate in one of the many events held at the Palacio Municipal de Congresos or the Recinto Ferial Juan Carlos I, as it is located in Campo de las Naciones, very close to Adolfo Suárez Madrid -Barajas Airport.

In order to provide for these types of guests, the hotel features several conference rooms and a long list of services so that they can work from the hotel at ease. And after a hard day of work, this four-star hotel suggests releasing stress at the gym or leaving all troubles behind while enjoying the market cuisine offered at its restaurant, Mayrit.

basicData.name: Urban
basicData.title: Urban
basicData.body:
Hotel Urban opened in October 2004, in the heart of the political, cultural, financial and shopping district, and very close to Puerta del Sol. Designed by architects Carles Bassò and Mariano Martitegui, the building is noteworthy both for its cutting-edge architectural design and the collection of priceless works of modern art it houses.

Interior designer Mérce Borrel, who worked in the hotel alongside Jordi, says: “the hotel originally took its inspiration from the Art Deco movement, combining the spirit of the past with more modern tendencies”. Built with the very best materials (fine woods and marble), the walls have been painted with bright colours in order to give the hotel a bright and luminous air. Borrel is keen to highlight one of the more innovative features, a sophisticated lighting system in the bedrooms that gives guests “a variety of options depending on their needs and the time of day”.

In addition, the bedrooms, corridors and public areas are an amazing art gallery containing late 19th century and early 20th century works from Papua New Guinea, the Museum of Egyptian Art and various oriental pieces. In summer it’s also possible to enjoy the outdoor swimming pool, with spectacular views over Madrid’s rooftops by day or by night.

Hotel Urban is home to Europa Decó restaurant, which serves Mediterranean cuisine featuring seasonal market produce with contemporary flair, in a cosmopolitan designer setting.
